description:
Hungary, September 1, 2020:
The National Government declares that Hungarian citizens and family members of Hungarian citizens who are not Hungarian citizens entering Hungary from abroad have to undergo a medical examination upon entry. Depending on the results of the medical examination, these individuals shall be quarantined differently, as per § 2, section 2 and § 3 of Government Decree 408/2020. Non-Hungarian citizens may not enter the territory of Hungary. However, various exceptions exist. Those who may be exempted for reasons such as attendance at family events have to undergo an application procedure where they can prove their purpose of entry.
No explicit end date is mentioned. UPDATE: Announced on September 1, 2020, Hungarian citizens and family members of Hungarian citizens who are not Hungarian citizens entering Hungary from the territory of the Czech Republic, Poland or Slovakia shall be allowed to enter Hungary if accommodation in these countries was booked before entry into force of Government Decree 419/2020. A negative PCR test may grant a waiver from quarantine orders for these individuals. Czech, Polish and Slovak citizens may enter the territory of Hungary if they can prove reservation for at least one day in a Hungarian accommodation facility on a date no later than 30 September 2020 and that the reservation was made before the entry into force of Government Decree 419/2020. Additionally, they have to submit a negative PCR test upon entry.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

Czech, Polish and Slovak citizens may enter the territory of Hungary if they can prove reservation for at least one day in a Hungarian accommodation facility on a date no later than 31 October 2020 and that the reservation was made before the entry into force of Government Decree 450/2020. Additionally, they have to submit a negative PCR test upon entry.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
Hungary, May 10, 2021:
The National Government declares that Hungarian citizens and family members of Hungarian citizens who are not Hungarian citizens entering Hungary from abroad have to undergo a medical examination upon entry. Depending on the results of the medical examination, these individuals shall be quarantined differently, as per § 2, section 2 and § 3 of Government Decree 408/2020. Non-Hungarian citizens may not enter the territory of Hungary. However, various exceptions exist. Those who may be exempted for reasons such as attendance at family events have to undergo an application procedure where they can prove their purpose of entry. Individuals under the age of eighteen crossing the border alongside those with an immunity certificate can also enter Hungary without restrictions.
No explicit end date is mentioned. description:
Hungary, May 22, 2021:
The National Government declares that Hungarian citizens and family members of Hungarian citizens who are not Hungarian citizens entering Hungary from abroad have to undergo a medical examination upon entry. Depending on the results of the medical examination, these individuals shall be quarantined differently, as per § 2, section 2 and § 3 of Government Decree 408/2020. Non-Hungarian citizens may not enter the territory of Hungary. However, various exceptions exist. Those who may be exempted for reasons such as attendance at family events have to undergo an application procedure where they can prove their purpose of entry. Those submitting an immunity certificate upon arrival can enter Hungary without any restrictions. Individuals under the age of eighteen crossing the border alongside those with an immunity certificate can also enter Hungary without restrictions. Hungary now unilaterally recognises immunity certificates issued by certain countries such as Romania.
No explicit end date is mentioned.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
Hungary, May 22, 2021:
The National Government declares that Hungarian citizens and family members of Hungarian citizens who are not Hungarian citizens entering Hungary from abroad have to undergo a medical examination upon entry. Depending on the results of the medical examination, these individuals shall be quarantined differently, as per § 2, section 2 and § 3 of Government Decree 408/2020. Non-Hungarian citizens may not enter the territory of Hungary. However, various exceptions exist. Those who may be exempted for reasons such as attendance at family events have to undergo an application procedure where they can prove their purpose of entry. Those submitting an immunity certificate upon arrival can enter Hungary without any restrictions. Individuals under the age of eighteen crossing the border alongside those with an immunity certificate can also enter Hungary without restrictions. Hungary now unilaterally recognises immunity certificates issued by certain countries.
No explicit end date is mentioned. UPDATE: From May 27, 2021, the entry into Hungary of the crew (flight crew and cabin crew) of any aircraft (Hungarian or non-Hungarian) arriving in Hungary from any foreign state shall in all cases be considered as for business purposes and the crew member may enter the territory of Hungary without any restriction, as per Government Decree 274/2021.

description:
Hungary, May 22, 2021:
The National Government declares that Hungarian citizens and family members of Hungarian citizens who are not Hungarian citizens entering Hungary from abroad have to undergo a medical examination upon entry. Depending on the results of the medical examination, these individuals shall be quarantined differently, as per § 2, section 2 and § 3 of Government Decree 408/2020. Non-Hungarian citizens may not enter the territory of Hungary. However, various exceptions exist. Those who may be exempted for reasons such as attendance at family events have to undergo an application procedure where they can prove their purpose of entry. Those submitting an immunity certificate upon arrival can enter Hungary without any restrictions. Individuals under the age of eighteen crossing the border alongside those with an immunity certificate can also enter Hungary without restrictions. Hungary now unilaterally recognises immunity certificates issued by certain countries such as Romania.
No explicit end date is mentioned. UPDATE: From June 9, 2021, immunity certificates issued by Slovakia are accepted by the Hungarian authorities.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: 2G: Must be (i) either vaccinated or (ii) recovered from COVID-19
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
Hungary, September 1, 2020:
The National Government declares that border controls are re-introduced until October 1, 2020. UPDATE: The policy expired on June 23, 2021.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description: Hungary closed its borders to all foreigners as of March 16, 2020. UPDATE: Originally Hungary closed its borders for all foreigners(with some exceptions in the last months), as of June.23.2021 Hungary opens its Schengen borders allowing restriction free travel to anyone entering the country from Croatia, Austria, Romania, Serbia, Slovakia, or Slovenia. But restrictions for people travelling by airplane remain the same.
date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)
target_geog_level: All countries
target_who_what: All Foreign Nationals (Foreign Residents + Foreign Travelers)
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time)

description:
Hungary, May 22, 2021:
The National Government declares that Hungarian citizens and family members of Hungarian citizens who are not Hungarian citizens entering Hungary from abroad have to undergo a medical examination upon entry. Depending on the results of the medical examination, these individuals shall be quarantined differently, as per § 2, section 2 and § 3 of Government Decree 408/2020. Non-Hungarian citizens may not enter the territory of Hungary. However, various exceptions exist. Those who may be exempted for reasons such as attendance at family events have to undergo an application procedure where they can prove their purpose of entry. Those submitting an immunity certificate upon arrival can enter Hungary without any restrictions. Individuals under the age of eighteen crossing the border alongside those with an immunity certificate can also enter Hungary without restrictions. Hungary now unilaterally recognises immunity certificates issued by certain countries.
No explicit end date is mentioned. UPDATE: From July 1, 2021, individuals under the age of eighteen, as per § 5 of Government Decree 348/2021, who register for and receive vaccination against SARS-CoV-2 in Hungary may also be exempted from entry restrictions.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
Hungary, May 22, 2021:
The National Government declares that Hungarian citizens and family members of Hungarian citizens who are not Hungarian citizens entering Hungary from abroad have to undergo a medical examination upon entry. Depending on the results of the medical examination, these individuals shall be quarantined differently, as per § 2, section 2 and § 3 of Government Decree 408/2020. Non-Hungarian citizens may not enter the territory of Hungary. However, various exceptions exist. Those who may be exempted for reasons such as attendance at family events have to undergo an application procedure where they can prove their purpose of entry. Those submitting an immunity certificate upon arrival can enter Hungary without any restrictions. Individuals under the age of eighteen crossing the border alongside those with an immunity certificate can also enter Hungary without restrictions. Hungary now unilaterally recognises immunity certificates issued by certain countries such as Romania.
No explicit end date is mentioned. UPDATE: From July 13, 2021, immunity certificates issued by San Marino are accepted by the Hungarian authorities.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
Hungary, April 15, 2020:
As per 'AboutHungary', Hungary’s health authorities begin inspecting the country’s 1,579 elderly care homes, concentrating on larger facilities where there is a higher risk of transmission of the coronavirus. According to MTI, the inspectors will check if the homes have implemented coronavirus-related measures, if they have a doctor, staff and members have been informed, if they have sufficient personnel and supplies, and if the relevant protocols are in place.

target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description:
Hungary, May 7, 2020:
The National Government declares that police may monitor compliance with official home quarantine rules via an electronic software suitable for tracking the movements of, transferring the facial image of, and transferring health data provided by, concerned persons. However, for those quarantined, the use of the software is voluntary.
The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends.

Hungary, May 7, 2020:
The National Government declares that those in quarantine who have agreed to using an electronic GPS-tracking software— which police uses to monitor compliance with official home quarantine rules—but fail to use and install the software are seen as committing an infraction.
The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends.

description:
Hungary, May 14, 2020:
The Ministry of Innovation and Technology (ITM) has announced that a new, official COVID-19 tracker app ("VirusRadar") is now available to download for people confirmed to be infected with the coronavirus. The app uses Bluetooth to communicate with other users and exchanges encrypted, anonymous data about the distance of surrounding devices if they have been at a dangerous distance for the past 14 days. The data forwarded to the authorities can be used to trace contacts patients had interacted with within a 2 meter distance for at least 20 minutes in the last 14 days. If a user becomes infected, they can share their data with this app, thereby notifying people who have been in close contact with an infected person. The app also asks permission to access users’ geographic location. The use of the app is voluntary.
date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)
type_sub_cat: A person’s absolute (e.g. GPS) location over time
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

Hungary, March 15, 2020:
The National Government declares that, if the license of a health care worker is to expire during the state of emergency, the validity of it shall be extended by 90 days after the expiry of the state of emergency. Hungary, September 19, 2020:
The National Government declares that, "[i]f an organ or person performing public duties [and] participat[ing] in [coronavirus] containment [efforts] [...] certifiably cannot, acting within its own competence, procure a medical device, personal protective equipment or other device [for] the containment of SARS-CoV-2 [...], or can only procure it at a disproportionate cost, then that organ or person may initiate the procurement of the device concerned by the National Healthcare Service Centre [...]".
The policy's ending is indefinite.

description:
Hungary, October 20, 2020:
As per HungaryToday, the flu vaccine was made available free of charge to everyone from their GP, the National Government decided. The main reason is that an additional great number of influenza-infected patients could seriously overburden the healthcare system. The flu shot is also important to doctors because it can help them factor out the flu when making a diagnosis. Also, the risk of death is doubled if someone suffers from COVID and the flu at the same time. Additionally, the government just purchased the full stock of one type of vaccine (a quadrivalent flu vaccine) available in Hungary.
date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description:
Hungary, January 1, 2021:
The National Government declares that, during the emergency situation, medical stock owned by the state (medical equipment, apparatus, medicines and disinfectants) may be transferred free of charge to the extent necessary for the prevention of the coronavirus epidemic or for any relevant public-service purpose. Recipients may be health care providers or other states.
The policy is slated to end on February 8, 2021. UPDATE: From February 8, 2021, this policy is extended indefinitely.

description:
Hungary, February 20, 2021:
The National Government declares that, during the state of emergency, retail stores as per § 1, sections 2 and 3 of Government Decree 68/2021 may be allowed to distribute medicines if licensed and complying with specific requirements such as that medicinal products may only be acquired from a source authorised to engage in the wholesale distribution of medicinal products. This policy primarily aims to increase the distribution of medicinal products to small settlements with a permanent population of less than 2,000 inhabitants.

description:
Hungary, March 28, 2021:
The National Government declares that, during the state of emergency, manufacturers of medicines, medical equipment and medical devices shall prioritize the production of products necessary for the prevention of SARS-CoV-2 infections and for the treatment of SARS-CoV-2 diseases. For this purpose, they may refuse to perform their other contractual obligations and no breach of contract claim may be brought or asserted against them in this respect.
The policy is slated to end on May 23, 2021.

description:
Hungary, November 6, 2020:
As per "HungaryToday", elective surgeries are being postponed, Cecília Müller, the chief medical officer, told an online press conference. Care for coronavirus patients must be further expanded, she said, justifying this measure.
The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: From May 13, 2021, "[h]ospitals in Hungary will resume elective surgeries and rehabilitation services[...], the human resources minister has said. Patients will be required to present valid Covid-19 immunity certificates, or, in its absence, a negative PCR test 48 hours prior to the procedure and a negative rapid antigen test on the day of the surgery".
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

Hungary, February 20, 2021:

description:
Hungary, March 16, 2020:
As per the 'European Observatory on Health Systems and Policies': The National Public Health Center published its procedure for COVID-19 testing. Among other things, patients with acute respiratory illness AND having been in close contact with a confirmed or probable COVID-19 case in the last 14 days prior to symptom onset are to be tested. Tests are to be conducted by one of the seven designated, accredited laboratories for direct detection of the virus. The testing of the patients in the hospitals is done in a pre-examination room in the triage area. It is possible to do a test in a private laboratory as well, but the National Public Health Center does not accept it as an official result. Anybody can request this test, at a cost of HUF 31 000 (the delivery is HUF 15 000). If it is positive, the laboratory notifies the National Public Health Center and sends the sample to them in order to do a confirmatory test. The private labs can do 40-50 tests/day in three locations nationwide.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: Symptomatic people,Confirmed contact to a person infected with COVID-19
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description:
Hungary, December 3, 2020:
The National Government declares that essential workers (health-care workers, teachers and staff members of social institutions/crèches) as well as certain occupational groups defined by the Operational Staff will be tested via rapid antigen tests on a regular basis, though participation is voluntary. Testing shall, as far as possible, be carried out at the subject's place of employment. In the event of a positive test result, the employed person shall immediately notify his/her general practitioner, who shall record the positive result in the National Occupational Information System (OSZIR).
The policy is slated to end on February 8, 2021.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Voluntary/Recommended but No Penalties
enforcer: National Government,Municipal Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description:
Hungary, March 29, 2020:
The National Government declares that "hospital commanders" are to be assigned to health care institutions in order to control the use of health supplies purchased from budgetary resources. A National Hospital Commander shall determine the scope of activities of hospital commanders and coordinate their activities. As per AboutHungary, "Tibor Benkő said that in an emergency situation it is extremely important that the virus should be handled under a unified command, and that the management and use of materials should be directed and controlled centrally. The minister said hospital commanders have a supporting role and are not involved in making decisions on medical or health issues. Their job is to submit proposals and requests to the national commander, who forwards them to the operative body in charge of handling novel coronavirus, he said."
The policy's ending is indefinite.

description:
Hungary, April 4, 2020:
The National Government declares that, "for the elimination of the consequences of the human epidemic endangering life and property and causing massive disease outbreaks, and in this respect, for the protection of the health and lives of Hungarian citizens, the Minister of Interior and the Minister of Human Capacities may, until the end of the period of state of danger at the latest, have access to, and may process, personal data processed by patient care providers and the healthcare state administration organ, or in the National eHealth Infrastructure, through its operator."
The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends.

description:
Hungary, April 7, 2020:
The National Government declares that the Operational Corps Responsible for the Containment of the Coronavirus Epidemic established on 31 January may, "for the performance of its tasks and for [...] learning about, locating, and preventing the further spread of, coronavirus cases and for organising the coordinated performance of the tasks of state organs, [...] request data provision from any organ, legal person, or organisation without legal personality, [...] [and] have the right to access personal identification, address and other contact or health data, and data in the relevant registers, of persons affected by the coronavirus disease, or by the suspicion of it, and of persons who are or were in contact with such a person, and who therefore are endangered persons from public health and epidemiological aspects. The operator of the National eHealth Infrastructure shall ensure that the Operational Corps receives directly all information concerning coronavirus cases, including personal data."
The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends.

The National Government "authorises the Minister responsible for traffic to establish, by means of an individual decision, a different order for ensuring traffic, a traffic restriction or a traffic prohibition. If [such] a decision [...] impacts cross-border traffic, the Minister responsible for traffic shall pass the individual decision with the agreement of the Minister responsible for border policing."
The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends.

description:
Hungary, April 30, 2020:
The National Government declares that "hospital commanders" ("institution commanders" in the case of long-term or temporary care institutions for the elderly with at least 200 places) are to be assigned to health care institutions in order to control the use of health supplies purchased from budgetary resources. A National Hospital Commander shall determine the scope of activities of hospital/institution commanders and coordinate their activities. As per AboutHungary from March 31, 2020, "Tibor Benkő said that in an emergency situation it is extremely important that the virus should be handled under a unified command, and that the management and use of materials should be directed and controlled centrally. The minister said hospital commanders have a supporting role and are not involved in making decisions on medical or health issues. Their job is to submit proposals and requests to the national commander, who forwards them to the operative body in charge of handling novel coronavirus, he said."
The policy's ending is indefinite.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description:
Hungary, March 29, 2020:
The National Government declares that "hospital commanders" are to be assigned to health care institutions in order to control the use of health supplies purchased from budgetary resources. A National Hospital Commander shall determine the scope of activities of hospital commanders and coordinate their activities. As per AboutHungary, "Tibor Benkő said that in an emergency situation it is extremely important that the virus should be handled under a unified command, and that the management and use of materials should be directed and controlled centrally. The minister said hospital commanders have a supporting role and are not involved in making decisions on medical or health issues. Their job is to submit proposals and requests to the national commander, who forwards them to the operative body in charge of handling novel coronavirus, he said."
The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: From April 30, 2020, commanders are also deployed to long-term or temporary care institutions for the elderly with at least 200 places (under the designation of "institution commanders").

description:
Hungary, March 17, 2020:
The National Government declares that, in order to avert the COVID-19 pandemic and protect the health and life of Hungarian citizens, the Minister of Innovation and Technology, as the member of the Government responsible for science policy and information technology, shall be entitled to access and manage any available data for the purpose of modelling and analysing the spread of the pandemic. State and local government bodies, business organisations and private persons shall support the Minister of Innovation and Technology in the performance of his/her duties and be obliged to provide the requested data.
The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends. UPDATE: The policy expired on June 17, 2020, alongside the state of emergency.

description:
Hungary, March 17, 2020:
On a government-run website, an appeal by the organizations of pediatricians is published which says that parents are asked "not to take their children suspected of having contracted coronavirus infection to surgeries or pediatric duty wards. They should instead call their pediatric practitioners or one of the toll-free numbers." The article provides further information for families by the Association of Pediatric Practitioners and the Safe Hands Scientific Society of Pediatric Practitioners, such as that "if parents – with or without their children – have been to a place affected by coronavirus infection but have no symptoms, they should return home and should consult with their general practitioner and employer before returning to work."
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)

compliance: Voluntary/Recommended but No Penalties

description:
Hungary, March 21, 2020:
On a government-run website, an appeal by the National Media and Infocommunications Authority is published which says that people should "[o]nly visit the post office if it's absolutely necessary". The article provides further information by the National Media and Infocommunications Authority, such as that "those who can should transfer money online instead of paying bills at the post office, should write e-mail messages instead of sending conventional mail, should check out webstores before placing an order and should track consignments on their websites".
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)

description:
Hungary, March 9, 2020:
In response to the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus, Hungarian authorities are instituting quarantine rules. Any foreign patients who refuse to cooperate with the authorities in this matter risk being expelled from the country. People who refuse to cooperate will be detained by the immigration police for six months, which can be extended for another six months, before being deported (HungaryToday, March 9).
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Hungary is forcing Hungarian citizens returning from Italy, China, South Korea and Iran to undergo designated quarantine if, during the medical examination, they are suspected of being infected with COVID-19. Those who are not suspected of being infected with COVID-19 during the health examination shall be placed under 'official home quarantine' (designated quarantine for non-residential Hungarian citizens staying in Hungary) for 14 days. EEA nationals as per § 8 of Government Decree 41/2020 shall be treated in the same way as Hungarian nationals. There's no explicit end date for this policy.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description:
Hungary, March 15, 2020:
The National Government declares that Hungarian citizens arriving from the territory of Italy, China, South Korea, Israel or Iran have to undergo designated quarantine if, during the medical examination, they are suspected of being infected with COVID-19. Those who are not suspected of being infected with COVID-19 during the health examination shall be placed under official home quarantine (or designated quarantine for non-residential Hungarian citizens staying in Hungary, respectively) for 14 days. EEA nationals as per § 8 of Government Decree 41/2020 shall be treated in the same way as Hungarian nationals. Exemptions may be granted in cases of special merit. There's no explicit end date for this policy.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Hungary, April 2, 2020:
The National Government declares that Hungarian citizens arriving by passenger transport from abroad have to undergo designated quarantine if, during the medical examination, they are suspected of being infected with COVID-19. Those who are not suspected of being infected with COVID-19 during the health examination shall be placed under official home quarantine (or designated quarantine for non-residential Hungarian citizens staying in Hungary, respectively) for 14 days, unless credibly proving that they have recovered from a COVID-19 infection and currently show no symptoms of infection, or have been under epidemiological surveillance for at least 14 days prior to entry. EEA nationals as per § 7 of Government Decree 81/2020 shall be treated in the same way as Hungarian nationals. Exceptions may be granted. There's no explicit end date for this policy.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries

description: Hungary announced new digital measures for the controlling of the home-quarantine of covid-patients at home on May.04.2020. Hungarian citizens who have to be in home-quarantine beacuse of Covid-Illness will have the opportunity to use a smartphone app (Home Quarantine System) developed to monitor home-quarantine cases. The use of the app is not mandatory, in the case someone doesn't want to use the app the police monitors their compliance with the government-ordered quarantine.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)

description:
Hungary, June 18, 2020:
The National Government enacts that non-Hungarian citizens arriving from abroad and exempted from entry restrictions shall be placed in quarantine or in an official house quarantine designated by the epidemiological authority for 14 days upon entry. This policy shall apply to the crossing of the border for unofficial purposes with a private passport and other travel documents. There's no explicit end date for this policy.

description:
Hungary, July 4, 2020:
The National Government enacts that non-Hungarian citizens arriving from abroad and exempted from entry restrictions shall be placed in quarantine or in an official house quarantine designated by the epidemiological authority for 14 days upon entry (designated or official house quarantine for those who, after a medical examination, are not suspected of being infected and designated quarantine for those with a valid residence permit who are tested positive). Those with a valid residence permit who are not suspected of being infected with COVID-19 are not required to undergo quarantine if they can prove, by means of a document in Hungarian or English containing the results of a PCR test carried out on two occasions within 5 days prior to entry into Hungary and in accordance with professional health regulations, that no SARS-CoV-2 virus is currently detectable in their body. This policy shall apply to the crossing of the border for unofficial purposes with a private passport and other travel documents. There's no explicit end date for this policy.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries
target_who_what: All Foreign Nationals (Foreign Residents + Foreign Travelers)

description:
Hungary, June 18, 2020:
The National Government enacts that non-Hungarian citizens arriving from abroad and exempted from entry restrictions shall be placed in quarantine or in an official house quarantine designated by the epidemiological authority for 14 days upon entry. This policy shall apply to the crossing of the border for unofficial purposes with a private passport and other travel documents. There's no explicit end date for this policy. UPDATE: From July 4, 2020, non-Hungarian citizens who hold a valid permit to enter Hungary, arrive from abroad and are suspected of being infected with COVID-19 after a medical examination shall be placed in quarantine designated by the epidemiological authority upon entry (these individuals were not allowed to enter Hungary before). Those who are not suspected of being infected with COVID-19 are no longer required to undergo quarantine if they can prove, by means of a document in Hungarian or English containing the results of a PCR test carried out on two occasions within 5 days prior to entry into Hungary and in accordance with professional health regulations, that no SARS-CoV-2 virus is currently detectable in their body.

description:
Hungary, July 15, 2020:
The National Government classifies countries into different categories: Green countries currently have a low infection rate, red countries currently have a severe infection rate and yellow countries a less severe. Individuals may enter Hungary from the territory of a green country without limitation. 
Hungarian citizens and those according to § 1, section 2 and § 3, section 1 of Government Decree 341/2020 are obliged to undergo a medical examination and go into quarantine when entering Hungary from a yellow or red country. Quarantine is not required if one can certify, by means of a document in Hungarian or English containing the result of a PCR test carried out on two occasions within 5 days prior to entry into Hungary with a time interval of at least 48 hours, that the SARS-CoV-2 virus was not detectable in his/her body at the time of the test. 
Non-Hungarian citizens arriving from a yellow country shall also undergo a health examination upon entry. If the health examination reveals a suspicion of infection, the individual shall not be allowed to enter the territory of Hungary. If not, the individual needs to go into quarantine (unless submitting a negative PCR test, see above). 
Non-Hungarian citizens arriving from a red country are not allowed to enter Hungary.
The list of countries classified as green, yellow or red can be found in the document "Közlemény a COVID-19...".
There are exceptions. The policy's ending is indefinite.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

Hungarian citizens and those according to §1, section 2 and §3, section 1 of Government Decree 341/2020 need to undergo a medical examination and go into quarantine when entering Hungary from a yellow or red country. Non-Hungarian citizens arriving from a red country are not allowed to enter Hungary.
The (updated) list of countries classified as green, yellow or red can be found in the document "Közlemény a COVID-19...".
There are exceptions. The policy's ending is indefinite.

description: The Hungarian government reintroduces the border protection measures and closes its borders to foreigners from September 1, 2020, with the preliminary end date of October 1, 2020. Hungarian nationals and residents returning home from abroad will be required to either self-quarantine for 14 days or produce two negative PCR tests taken two days apart.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description:
Hungary, September 1, 2020:
The National Government declares that Hungarian citizens and family members of Hungarian citizens who are not Hungarian citizens (as well as those treated in the same way as a Hungarian citizen - see § 1, section 2 of Government Decree 408/2020) entering Hungary from abroad have to undergo a medical examination upon entry. Depending on the results of the medical examination, these individuals shall be quarantined differently, as per § 2, section 2 and § 3 of Government Decree 408/2020. Non-Hungarian citizens who are exempted from entry restrictions and not suspected of being infected during a medical examination are also placed in quarantine.
There are exceptions. No explicit end date is mentioned.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
Hungary, August 21, 2020:
The National Government classifies countries (as of July 16, including their administrative regions) into different categories: Green countries currently have a low infection rate, red countries a severe infection rate and yellow countries a less severe. Individuals may enter Hungary from the territory of a green country without limitation.
Hungarian citizens and those according to §1, section 2 and §3, section 1 of Government Decree 341/2020 need to undergo a medical examination and go into quarantine when entering Hungary from a yellow or red country. Quarantine is not required if one can certify, by means of a document in Hungarian or English containing the result of a PCR test carried out on two occasions within 5 days prior to entry into Hungary with a time interval of at least 48 hours, that the SARS-CoV-2 virus was not detectable in his/her body at the time of the test.
Non-Hungarian citizens arriving from a yellow country shall also undergo a health examination upon entry. If it reveals a suspicion of infection, the individual shall not be allowed to enter Hungary. If not, the individual needs to go into quarantine (unless submitting a negative PCR test, see above).
Non-Hungarian citizens arriving from a red country are not allowed to enter Hungary.
The (updated) list of countries classified as green, yellow or red can be found in the document "Közlemény a COVID-19...".
There are exceptions. The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: This policy was replaced by Government Decree 408/2020 on September 1, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
Hungary, September 1, 2020:
The National Government declares that Hungarian citizens and family members of Hungarian citizens who are not Hungarian citizens (as well as those treated in the same way as a Hungarian citizen - see § 1, section 2 of Government Decree 408/2020) entering Hungary from abroad have to undergo a medical examination upon entry. Depending on the results of the medical examination, these individuals shall be quarantined differently, as per § 2, section 2 and § 3 of Government Decree 408/2020. Non-Hungarian citizens who are exempted from entry restrictions and not suspected of being infected during a medical examination are also placed in quarantine.
There are exceptions. No explicit end date is mentioned. UPDATE: Announced on September 1, 2020, Hungarian citizens and family members of Hungarian citizens who are not Hungarian citizens entering Hungary from the territory of the Czech Republic, Poland or Slovakia may receive a waiver from quarantine provisions if accommodation in these countries was booked before entry into force of Government Decree 419/2020 and a negative PCR test is conducted in Hungary.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: All countries

description:
Hungary, September 5, 2020:
The National Government declares that Hungarian citizens and family members of Hungarian citizens who are not Hungarian citizens (as well as those treated in the same way as a Hungarian citizen - see § 1, section 2 of Government Decree 408/2020) entering Hungary from abroad have to undergo a medical examination upon entry. Depending on the results of the medical examination, these individuals shall be quarantined differently, as per § 2, section 2 and § 3 of Government Decree 408/2020. Non-Hungarian citizens who are exempted from entry restrictions and not suspected of being infected during a medical examination are also placed in quarantine. Two negative PCR test results may grant a waiver from quarantine orders, as per § 4 and § 7, sections 4 to 5 of Government Decree 408/2020 (as of September 5).
There are exceptions. No explicit end date is mentioned. UPDATE: From October 28, 2020, fines for violating official house quarantine rules are increased. Violators of the quarantine rules can be fined from HUF 5,000 to 150,000, with a maximum fine of HUF 600,000 per offender per day.

description:
Hungary, May 2, 2021:
The National Government declares that Hungarian citizens and family members of Hungarian citizens who are not Hungarian citizens (as well as those treated in the same way as a Hungarian citizen - see § 1, section 2 of Government Decree 408/2020) entering Hungary from abroad have to undergo a medical examination upon entry. Depending on the results of the medical examination, these individuals shall be quarantined differently, as per § 2, section 2 and § 3 of Government Decree 408/2020. Non-Hungarian citizens who are exempted from entry restrictions and not suspected of being infected during a medical examination are also placed in quarantine. Two negative PCR test results may grant a waiver from quarantine orders, as per § 4 and § 7, sections 4 to 5 of Government Decree 408/2020 (as of May 2).
There are exceptions.
No explicit end date is mentioned. UPDATE: From May 10, 2021, an individual under the age of eighteen who is under the supervision of a person with a valid immunity certificate and who crosses the border of Hungary with that person may also be exempted from quarantine provisions.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

Depending on the results of the medical examination, these individuals shall be quarantined differently, as per § 2, section 2 and § 3 of Government Decree 408/2020. description:
Hungary, May 2, 2021:
The National Government declares that Hungarian citizens and family members of Hungarian citizens who are not Hungarian citizens (as well as those treated in the same way as a Hungarian citizen - see § 1, section 2 of Government Decree 408/2020) entering Hungary from abroad have to undergo a medical examination upon entry. Depending on the results of the medical examination, these individuals shall be quarantined differently, as per § 2, section 2 and § 3 of Government Decree 408/2020. Non-Hungarian citizens who are exempted from entry restrictions and not suspected of being infected during a medical examination are also placed in quarantine. Two negative PCR test results may grant a waiver from quarantine orders, as per § 4 and § 7, sections 4 to 5 of Government Decree 408/2020 (as of May 2).
There are exceptions.
No explicit end date is mentioned. UPDATE: From August 7, 2021, individuals from the territory of Ukraine who enter Hungary by means other than civil aircraft may also be exempted from quarantine provisions. Exceptions may now also be granted to those who certify, by means of a document in Hungarian or English containing the result of a PCR test carried out in one of the countries referred to in § 3, section 2a, letters (a) to (i) of Government Decree 60/2021 which is not older than 72 hours, that the SARS-CoV-2 virus was not detectable in their body at the time of the test.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description:
Hungary, November 29, 2021:
The National Government declares that Hungarian citizens and family members of Hungarian citizens who are not Hungarian citizens (as well as those treated in the same way as a Hungarian citizen - see § 1, section 2 of Government Decree 408/2020) entering Hungary from abroad have to undergo a medical examination upon entry. Depending on the results of the medical examination, these individuals shall be quarantined differently, as per § 2, section 2 and § 3 of Government Decree 408/2020. Non-Hungarian citizens who are exempted from entry restrictions and not suspected of being infected during a medical examination are also placed in quarantine. Two negative PCR test results may grant a waiver from quarantine orders, as per § 4 and § 7, sections 4 to 5 of Government Decree 408/2020 (as of August 7). There are special provisions for individuals arriving from the territories of Botswana, South Africa, Swaziland (Eswatini), Lesotho, Mozambique, Namibia or Zimbabwe ("states at particular risk from the coronavirus epidemic") or any other state if having stayed in the territory of the aforementioned countries for any length of time during the 14 days preceding their entry into the territory of Hungary, respectively: The duration of quarantine is 14, and not 10, days here and they cannot get a waiver from quarantine orders by means of two (negative) PCR tests.
There are exceptions.
No explicit end date is mentioned.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

Depending on the results of the medical examination, these individuals shall be quarantined differently, as per § 2, section 2 and § 3 of Government Decree 408/2020. Hungary, March 17, 2020:
The National Government declares that it shall be forbidden to visit theatre, dance and music arts performances as well as cinemas, except for those employed there. The policy's ending is indefinite.

description:
Hungary, March 17, 2020:
The National Government declares that it shall be forbidden to stay in a store and catering facility between 3 pm and 6 am except for those employed there. Stores selling food, toiletries, drugstore products,
household detergents, chemical products or sanitary paper products, and pharmacies, stores marketing medical devices, filling stations and tobacco shops are exempted. Staying in a catering facility shall be allowed between 3 pm and 6 am for the purpose and the period of ordering and receiving, or paying for, food for takeaway. The policy's ending is indefinite.

description:
Hungary, March 19, 2020:
The National Government declares that employers may alter an employee's work schedule in a way different from common rules, unilaterally order employees to work at home or to work remotely and take necessary and justified measures for checking the health of employees.
The policy's ending is indefinite.

description:
Hungary, April 4, 2020:
The National Government declares that postal deliveries to addresses temporarily designated as quarantine places can only be done by means of a letter box. If that's not possible, the mail shall, for the time being, be kept at the disposal of a person not subject to quarantine if expressly requested so by the addressee. In non-quarantine cases, postal service providers may deliver registered mail by means of a letter box or, if identity checks are necessary, from a distance of about 1.5 metres to the addressee without taking a signature.
The policy is slated to end alongside the state of emergency.

description:
Hungary, May 4, 2020:
The National Government declares that, except for those employed there, it is forbidden to stay in a catering facility. This shall not apply to takeaway and delivery of food. However, it is permitted to stay in the garden or terrace of a catering facility, in particular a restaurant, café, confectionery, buffet, or press bar, and to consume the food or drink ordered, provided that social distancing measures are followed. If the terrace of a catering facility is located in a public area, operators shall not be required to pay the public area use fee until September 1, 2020. This policy applies to all of Hungary except for Budapest and Pest county. The policy ends alongside the state of emergency.

Hungary, May 4, 2020:
The National Government declares that, between 9 and 12 am, grocery stores, drugstores, pharmacies and shops selling medicines or medical aids may only be visited by persons who have attained the age of 65 years. description:
Hungary, March 28, 2020:
The National Government declares that, between 9 and 12 am, grocery stores, drugstores, markets or pharmacies may only be visited by persons who have attained the age of 65 years. The policy is slated to end on April 11, 2020. UPDATE: From May 4, 2020, "shops selling medicines or medical devices" are also obliged to follow this policy. Ensuring the availability of exclusive business hours for persons over 65 years of age at markets is now the responsibility of municipal governments. These policy changes affect all of Hungary except for Budapest and Pest county.

description:
Hungary, April 10, 2020:
The National Government declares that it shall be forbidden to stay in a store between 3 pm and 6 am, except for those employed there. Stores selling food, toiletries, drugstore products, household detergents, chemical products or sanitary paper products, and pharmacies, stores marketing medical devices and filling stations are exempted. The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: From May 4, 2020, restrictions on business hours are lifted. This policy change affects all of Hungary except for Budapest and Pest county.

description:
Hungary, May 18, 2020:
The National Government declares that the serving of food and drinks inside of a catering facility is allowed if employees wear a face mask in the areas accessible to customers and social distancing measures are followed. It is also permitted to stay in the garden or terrace of a catering facility and to consume the food or drink ordered, provided that social distancing measures are followed. If the terrace of a catering facility is located in a public area, operators shall not be required to pay the public area use fee until September 1, 2020. Catering facilities are not allowed the use of equipment with internal air circulation. This policy applies to all of Hungary except for Budapest. The policy ends alongside the state of emergency.

description:
Hungary, May 29, 2020:
The National Government declares that the serving of food and drinks inside of a catering facility is allowed if employees wear a face mask in the areas accessible to customers and social distancing measures are followed. It is also permitted to stay in the garden or terrace of a catering facility and to consume the food or drink ordered, provided that social distancing measures are followed. If the terrace of a catering facility is located in a public area, operators shall not be required to pay the public area use fee until September 1, 2020. Catering facilities are not allowed the use of equipment with internal air circulation. The policy ends alongside the state of emergency.

description:
Hungary, May 18, 2020:
The National Government declares that, between 9 and 12 am, grocery stores, drugstores, pharmacies and shops selling medicines or medical aids may only be visited by persons who have attained the age of 65 years. Social distancing and face covering measures need to be followed (the former in general) here. The policy ends alongside the state of emergency. UPDATE: This policy expired on June 17, 2020, alongside the state of emergency.

description:
Hungary, April 4, 2020:
The National Government declares that postal deliveries to addresses temporarily designated as quarantine places can only be done by means of a letter box. If that's not possible, the mail shall, for the time being, be kept at the disposal of a person not subject to quarantine if expressly requested so by the addressee. In non-quarantine cases, postal service providers may deliver registered mail by means of a letter box or, if identity checks are necessary, from a distance of about 1.5 metres to the addressee without taking a signature.
The policy is slated to end alongside the state of emergency. UPDATE: The policy ended on June 17, 2020, as the state of emergency ended on that day.

Hungary, March 19, 2020:
The National Government declares that employers may alter an employee's work schedule in a way different from common rules, unilaterally order employees to work at home or to work remotely and take necessary and justified measures for checking the health of employees.
The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: The policy ended on June 17, 2020, as the state of emergency ended on that day.

description:
Hungary, May 29, 2020:
The National Government declares that the serving of food and drinks inside of a catering facility is allowed if employees wear a face mask in the areas accessible to customers and social distancing measures are followed. It is also permitted to stay in the garden or terrace of a catering facility and to consume the food or drink ordered, provided that social distancing measures are followed. If the terrace of a catering facility is located in a public area, operators shall not be required to pay the public area use fee until September 1, 2020. Catering facilities are not allowed the use of equipment with internal air circulation. The policy ends alongside the state of emergency. UPDATE: From June 18, 2020, all rules are dropped except for the one that employees working in the interior (closed) part of a catering facility, in areas frequented by customers, must wear a device covering the mouth and nose (e.g. medical mask, scarf, bandana).

description:
Hungary, September 21, 2020:
The National Government declares that catering facilities may receive guests from 6 am to 11 pm only. Outside of this time frame, only employees may stay in catering facilities and takeaway orders are permitted. Except for the guests of a catering facility, individuals have to wear a mask. In office or business areas within catering facilities, face covering rules do not apply. The policy's ending is indefinite.

description:
Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that shops (including lotteries and national tobacconist's shops) have to shut their doors from 7 pm to 5 am. Within this time frame, only employees may be present there. Pharmacies and petrol stations are exempted. 
During business hours, all individuals are obliged to wear a face mask inside of a shop and on the premises of a shopping centre (with respect to the latter, excluding office areas and premises used for sports and business purposes). Minors under the age of six are exempted from the obligation to wear a mask. 
Out-of-store/off-premises commercial activities may be allowed as per § 15 of Government Decree 484/2020.
The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020.

description:
Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that staying in a catering facility is only allowed for employees and guests ordering takeaway food. Exceptions apply to: Restaurants or canteens at the workplace; restaurants or bars in a place of accommodation if only serving the guests of the accommodation; canteens or canteen-service bars of a public educational establishment or a vocational training establishment if only serving employees or pupils of the educational establishment; and restaurants or canteens in a health care establishment.
Inside of a catering facility, all individuals have to wear a mask, except minors under the age of six.
Out-of-store/off-premises commercial activities may be allowed as per § 15 of Government Decree 484/2020.
The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020.

description:
Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that accommodation providers have to shut their doors for all individuals except persons employed there, persons staying there for business, economic or educational reasons, persons belonging to the Hungarian Defence Forces or law enforcement agencies staying there for the purpose of performing their official duties, as well as seconded health care workers. The places referred to in § 12, section 1 of Government Decree 484/2020 shall, if available, be closed. Within catering establishments of accommodation providers, all individuals have to wear a mask.
The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020.

Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that cinemas, gyms and fitness centres, swimming pools, ice rinks, zoos, wildlife parks, adventure parks, amusement parks and playhouses have to shut their doors for all individuals except persons employed there. The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020.

description:
Hungary, September 21, 2020:
The National Government declares that catering facilities may receive guests from 6 am to 11 pm only. Outside of this time frame, only employees may stay in catering facilities and takeaway orders are permitted. Except for the guests of a catering facility, individuals have to wear a mask. In office or business areas within catering facilities, face covering rules do not apply. The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: From November 11, 2020, staying in a catering facility is only allowed for employees and guests ordering takeaway food, with the exception of restaurants or canteens at the workplace, restaurants or bars in a place of accommodation if only serving the guests of the accommodation, canteens or canteen-service bars of a public educational establishment or a vocational training establishment if only serving employees or pupils of the educational establishment, and restaurants or canteens in a health care establishment.

description:
Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that shops (including lotteries and national tobacconist's shops) have to shut their doors from 7 pm to 5 am. Within this time frame, only employees may be present there. Pharmacies and petrol stations are exempted. 
During business hours, all individuals are obliged to wear a face mask inside of a shop and on the premises of a shopping centre (with respect to the latter, excluding office areas and premises used for sports and business purposes). Minors under the age of six are exempted from the obligation to wear a mask. 
Out-of-store/off-premises commercial activities may be allowed as per § 15 of Government Decree 484/2020.
The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020. UPDATE: From November 20, 2020, persons with an autism spectrum disorder are also exempted from the obligation to wear a mask.

description:
Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that accommodation providers have to shut their doors for all individuals except persons employed there, persons staying there for business, economic or educational reasons, persons belonging to the Hungarian Defence Forces or law enforcement agencies staying there for the purpose of performing their official duties, as well as seconded health care workers. The places referred to in § 12, section 1 of Government Decree 484/2020 shall, if available, be closed. Within catering establishments of accommodation providers, all individuals have to wear a mask.
The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020. UPDATE: From November 20, 2020, persons with an autism spectrum disorder are also exempted from the obligation to wear a mask.

description:
Hungary, November 24, 2020:
The National Government declares that shops (including lotteries and national tobacconist's shops) have to shut their doors from 7 pm to 5 am. Within this time frame, only employees may be present there. Pharmacies and petrol stations are exempted.
On weekdays between 9 and 11 am and at weekends between 8 and 10 am, only persons who are 65 years of age or older are allowed to visit grocery stores, drugstores and pharmacies.
During business hours, all individuals are obliged to wear a face mask inside of a shop and on the premises of a shopping centre (with respect to the latter, excluding office areas and premises used for sports and business purposes). Minors under the age of six and persons with an autism spectrum disorder are exempted from the obligation to wear a mask.
Out-of-store/off-premises commercial activities may be allowed as per § 15 of Government Decree 484/2020 (as of November 24, 2020).
The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020.

description:
Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that shops (including lotteries and national tobacconist's shops) have to shut their doors from 7 pm to 5 am. Within this time frame, only employees may be present there. Pharmacies and petrol stations are exempted. 
During business hours, all individuals are obliged to wear a face mask inside of a shop and on the premises of a shopping centre (with respect to the latter, excluding office areas and premises used for sports and business purposes). UPDATE: From November 24, 2020, grocery stores, drugstores and pharmacies are obliged to provide protected shopping hours for persons over 65 years of age on weekdays between 9 and 11 am and at weekends between 8 and 10 am. Other persons are not allowed to visit these stores during the times mentioned. Grocery stores, drugstores and pharmacies may also be freely visited by persons over 65 years of age outside the protected shopping hours.

The National Government declares that shops (including lotteries and national tobacconist's shops) have to shut their doors from 7 pm to 5 am. Within this time frame, only employees may be present there. Pharmacies and petrol stations are exempted.
On weekdays between 9 and 11 am and at weekends between 8 and 10 am, only persons who are 65 years of age or older are allowed to visit grocery stores, drugstores and pharmacies.

description:
Hungary, November 24, 2020:
The National Government declares that shops (including lotteries and national tobacconist's shops) have to shut their doors from 7 pm to 5 am. Within this time frame, only employees may be present there. Pharmacies and petrol stations are exempted.
On weekdays between 9 and 11 am and at weekends between 8 and 10 am, only persons who are 65 years of age or older are allowed to visit grocery stores, drugstores and pharmacies.
During business hours, all individuals are obliged to wear a face mask inside of a shop and on the premises of a shopping centre (with respect to the latter, excluding office areas and premises used for sports and business purposes). Minors under the age of six and persons with an autism spectrum disorder are exempted from the obligation to wear a mask.
Out-of-store/off-premises commercial activities may be allowed as per § 15 of Government Decree 484/2020 (as of November 24, 2020).
The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020. UPDATE: From December 10, 2020, this policy is extended until January 11, 2021.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that staying in a catering facility is only allowed for employees and guests ordering takeaway food. Exceptions apply to: Restaurants or canteens at the workplace; restaurants or bars in a place of accommodation if only serving the guests of the accommodation; canteens or canteen-service bars of a public educational establishment or a vocational training establishment if only serving employees or pupils of the educational establishment; and restaurants or canteens in a health care establishment.
Inside of a catering facility, all individuals have to wear a mask, except minors under the age of six.
Out-of-store/off-premises commercial activities may be allowed as per § 15 of Government Decree 484/2020.
The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020. UPDATE: From December 10, 2020, this policy is extended until January 11, 2021.

description:
Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that accommodation providers have to shut their doors for all individuals except persons employed there, persons staying there for business, economic or educational reasons, persons belonging to the Hungarian Defence Forces or law enforcement agencies staying there for the purpose of performing their official duties, as well as seconded health care workers. The places referred to in § 12, section 1 of Government Decree 484/2020 shall, if available, be closed. Within catering establishments of accommodation providers, all individuals have to wear a mask.
The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020. UPDATE: From December 10, 2020, this policy is extended until January 11, 2021.

description:
Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that cinemas, gyms and fitness centres, swimming pools, ice rinks, zoos, wildlife parks, adventure parks, amusement parks and playhouses have to shut their doors for all individuals except persons employed there. Ice rinks, swimming pools, gyms, fitness centres and sports facilities may be visited by competitive athletes.
The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020. UPDATE: From December 10, 2020, this policy is extended until January 11, 2021.

description:
Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that staying in a catering facility is only allowed for employees and guests ordering takeaway food. Exceptions apply to: Restaurants or canteens at the workplace; restaurants or bars in a place of accommodation if only serving the guests of the accommodation; canteens or canteen-service bars of a public educational establishment or a vocational training establishment if only serving employees or pupils of the educational establishment; and restaurants or canteens in a health care establishment.
Inside of a catering facility, all individuals have to wear a mask, except minors under the age of six.
Out-of-store/off-premises commercial activities may be allowed as per § 15 of Government Decree 484/2020.
The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020. UPDATE: From January 30, 2021, if those in charge of catering facilities do not comply with the measures imposed upon them, their establishment may be forced to close for 6 to 12 months. Also, the policy is extended until March 1, 2021.

description:
Hungary, December 12, 2020:
The National Government declares that shops (including lotteries and national tobacconist's shops) have to shut their doors from 7 pm to 5 am. Within this time frame, only employees may be present there. Pharmacies and petrol stations are exempted.
During business hours, all individuals are obliged to wear a face mask inside of a shop and on the premises of a shopping centre (with respect to the latter, excluding office areas and premises used for sports and business purposes). Employers may grant breaks from wearing a mask. Minors under the age of six and persons with an intellectual or psychosocial disability or autism spectrum disorder are exempted from the obligation to wear a mask.
Out-of-store/off-premises commercial activities may be allowed as per § 15 of Government Decree 484/2020 (as of December 12, 2020).
The policy is slated to end on January 11, 2021. UPDATE: From February 28, 2021, this policy is extended until March 16, 2021.

description:
Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that staying in a catering facility is only allowed for employees and guests ordering takeaway food. Exceptions apply to: Restaurants or canteens at the workplace; restaurants or bars in a place of accommodation if only serving the guests of the accommodation; canteens or canteen-service bars of a public educational establishment or a vocational training establishment if only serving employees or pupils of the educational establishment; and restaurants or canteens in a health care establishment.
Inside of a catering facility, all individuals have to wear a mask, except minors under the age of six.
Out-of-store/off-premises commercial activities may be allowed as per § 15 of Government Decree 484/2020.
The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020. UPDATE: From February 28, 2021, this policy is extended until March 16, 2021.

description:
Hungary, March 8, 2021:
The National Government declares that all shops/stores have to shut their doors from 5 am to 8 pm ("curfew-free time"). Within this time frame, only employees may be present there. Grocery shops, drugstores, work-related shops (see § 4, section 2, letter c) of Government Decree 104/2021), animal shops, agricultural shops, gardening shops, markets, pharmacies, petrol stations, national tobacconists' shops and newsagents are exempted.
Exempted businesses, with the exception of pharmacies and petrol stations, have to close at 7 pm. During business hours, all individuals are obliged to wear a face mask inside of a shop and on the premises of a shopping centre (with respect to the latter, excluding office areas and premises used for sports and business purposes). Employers may grant breaks from wearing a mask. Minors under the age of six and persons with an intellectual or psychosocial disability or autism spectrum disorder are exempted from the obligation to wear a mask.
Out-of-store/off-premises commercial activities may be allowed as per § 15 of Government Decree 484/2020 (as of March 8, 2021).
The policy is slated to end on March 22, 2021.

Exceptions apply to: Restaurants or canteens at the workplace; restaurants or bars in a place of accommodation if only serving the guests of the accommodation; canteens or canteen-service bars of a public educational establishment or a vocational training establishment if only serving employees or pupils of the educational establishment; and restaurants or canteens in a health care establishment.
Inside of a catering facility, all individuals have to wear a mask, except minors under the age of six.
Out-of-store/off-premises commercial activities may be allowed as per § 15 of Government Decree 484/2020.
The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020. UPDATE: From March 20, 2021, this policy is extended until March 29, 2021.

target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Hungary, March 8, 2021:
The National Government declares that accommodation providers have to shut their doors for all individuals except persons employed there, persons staying there for business, economic or educational reasons, persons belonging to the Hungarian Defence Forces or law enforcement agencies staying there for the purpose of performing their official duties, as well as seconded health care workers. The places referred to in § 12, section 1 of Government Decree 484/2020 (as of March 8, 2021) as well as gambling casinos and card rooms shall, if available, be closed for guests. Within catering establishments of accommodation providers, all individuals have to wear a mask.
The policy is slated to end on March 22, 2021. UPDATE: From March 20, 2021, this policy is extended until March 29, 2021.

description:
Hungary, March 8, 2021:
The National Government declares that all shops/stores have to shut their doors from 5 am to 8 pm ("curfew-free time"). Within this time frame, only employees may be present there. Grocery shops, drugstores, work-related shops (see § 4, section 2, letter c) of Government Decree 104/2021), animal shops, agricultural shops, gardening shops, markets, pharmacies, petrol stations, national tobacconists' shops and newsagents are exempted.
Exempted businesses, with the exception of pharmacies and petrol stations, have to close at 7 pm. During business hours, all individuals are obliged to wear a face mask inside of a shop and on the premises of a shopping centre (with respect to the latter, excluding office areas and premises used for sports and business purposes). Employers may grant breaks from wearing a mask. Minors under the age of six and persons with an intellectual or psychosocial disability or autism spectrum disorder are exempted from the obligation to wear a mask.
Out-of-store/off-premises commercial activities may be allowed as per § 15 of Government Decree 484/2020 (as of March 8, 2021).
The policy is slated to end on March 22, 2021. UPDATE: From March 28, 2021, this policy is extended until April 8, 2021.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
institution_cat: No information in the policy about whether the business is considered essential or non-essential

target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that staying in a catering facility is only allowed for employees and guests ordering takeaway food. Exceptions apply to: Restaurants or canteens at the workplace; restaurants or bars in a place of accommodation if only serving the guests of the accommodation; canteens or canteen-service bars of a public educational establishment or a vocational training establishment if only serving employees or pupils of the educational establishment; and restaurants or canteens in a health care establishment.
Inside of a catering facility, all individuals have to wear a mask, except minors under the age of six.
Out-of-store/off-premises commercial activities may be allowed as per § 15 of Government Decree 484/2020.
The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020. UPDATE: From April 16, 2021, this policy is extended indefinitely.

description:
Hungary, April 24, 2021:
The National Government declares that, between 5 am and 9:30 pm, it is permitted to stay in the garden or terrace of a catering facility and consume ordered food or drinks there. In the garden or terrace of a catering establishment, employees who come into contact with a guest shall wear a mask. Guests are not required to wear a mask there. Staying inside of a catering facility is, at all times, only allowed for the purpose of serving and delivering takeaway food. This rule does not apply to workplace restaurants or canteens, restaurants or bars within accommodation providers if only serving their guests, canteens or canteen-service bars of a public educational establishment or a vocational training establishment if only serving employees or pupils of the educational establishment, and restaurants or canteens in a health establishment. Except for minors under six years of age and persons with intellectual or psychosocial disabilities or autism spectrum disorder, everyone inside of a catering facility shall wear a mask.
The policy's ending is indefinite.

description:
Hungary, May 1, 2021:
The National Government declares that accommodation providers have to shut their doors for all individuals except persons employed there, persons staying there for business, economic or educational reasons, persons belonging to the Hungarian Defence Forces or law enforcement agencies staying there for the purpose of performing their official duties, seconded health care workers and those protected against the coronavirus (that is, having an immunity certificate as per section 1/A of Government Decree 484/2020 as of May 1, 2021) as well as persons under the age of eighteen years who are under the supervision of protected persons. Employees should wear a mask if not protected against the coronavirus in the areas and places of the accommodation which may be visited by guests. It is prohibited to organise or hold a musical or dancing event in an accommodation provider. Family or private events may be organised or held in an accommodation provider if the number of persons present at any one time does not exceed ten. The places referred to in § 12, section 1 of Government Decree 484/2020 (as of May 1, 2021) may, if available in the acc. provider, be visited by guests protected against the coronavirus and those under their supervision. Gambling casinos and card rooms may, if available there, be visited by guests protected against the coronavirus.
The policy's ending is indefinite.

description:
Hungary, May 1, 2021:
The National Government declares that cinemas, zoos, wildlife parks, adventure parks, amusement parks and playhouses may be visited by those protected against the coronavirus (that is, having an immunity certificate as per section 1/A of Government Decree 484/2020 as of May 1, 2021) as well as persons under the age of eighteen years who are under the supervision of protected persons. Ice rinks, swimming pools, gyms, fitness centres and sports facilities may be visited by competitive athletes under the age of eighteen, their coaches or persons protected against the coronavirus. Employees should wear a mask if not protected against the coronavirus in the areas and places open to visitors. Business hours are limited to between 5 am and 11 pm, with the exception of ice rinks, swimming pools, gyms, fitness centres and sports facilities.
The policy's ending is indefinite.

description:
Hungary, May 1, 2021:
The National Government declares that, between 5 am and 11 pm, it is permitted to stay in the garden or terrace of a catering facility and consume ordered food or drinks there. Staying inside of a catering facility and consuming food or drinks there is, at this time, only allowed for those protected against the coronavirus (that is, having an immunity certificate as per section 1/A of Government Decree 484/2020 as of May 1, 2021) as well as persons under the age of eighteen years who are under the supervision of protected persons. Staying inside of a catering facility is also allowed for the purpose of serving and delivering takeaway food, for the purpose of using a toilet inside of catering facilities, and, where it is not possible to do so in the garden or on the terrace, for the purpose of paying for consumption. This rule does not apply to, for example, workplace restaurants or canteens (see exceptions section). It is prohibited to organise or hold a musical or dancing event in a catering facility. Family or private events may be organised or held in a catering facility if the number of persons present at any one time does not exceed ten. Guests should not wear a mask at catering facilities whenever they are seated at a table, consuming food or drinks when not seated at a table or when located on the patio or terrace of a catering establishment. Employees should wear a mask if not protected against the coronavirus.
The policy's ending is indefinite.

The National Government declares that gambling casinos and card rooms shall be kept closed, except for persons employed therein.
The policy is slated to end on April 19, 2021. UPDATE: From May 1, 2021, gambling casinos and card rooms may be visited by persons protected against the coronavirus.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
