target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)

description:
Hungary, May 10, 2021:
The National Government declares that cinemas, zoos, wildlife parks, adventure parks, amusement parks and playhouses may be visited by those protected against the coronavirus (that is, having an immunity certificate as per section 1/A of Government Decree 484/2020 as of May 10, 2021) as well as persons under the age of eighteen years who are under the supervision of protected persons. Ice rinks, swimming pools, gyms, fitness centres and sports facilities may be visited by competitive athletes under the age of eighteen, their coaches, children or pupils in the context of a physical education class, a sports club (including a school sports circle) or a sports education programme when accompanied by respective supervisors, or persons protected against the coronavirus. Employees should wear a mask if not protected against the coronavirus in the areas and places open to visitors. Business hours are limited to between 5 am and 11 pm, with the exception of ice rinks, swimming pools, gyms, fitness centres and sports facilities.
The policy's ending is indefinite.

description:
Hungary, May 1, 2021:
The National Government declares that cinemas, zoos, wildlife parks, adventure parks, amusement parks and playhouses may be visited by those protected against the coronavirus (that is, having an immunity certificate as per section 1/A of Government Decree 484/2020 as of May 1, 2021) as well as persons under the age of eighteen years who are under the supervision of protected persons. Ice rinks, swimming pools, gyms, fitness centres and sports facilities may be visited by competitive athletes under the age of eighteen, their coaches or persons protected against the coronavirus. Employees should wear a mask if not protected against the coronavirus in the areas and places open to visitors. Business hours are limited to between 5 am and 11 pm, with the exception of ice rinks, swimming pools, gyms, fitness centres and sports facilities.
The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: From May 10, 2021, ice rinks, swimming pools, gyms, fitness centres and sports facilities may also be visited by children or pupils in the context of a physical education class, a sports club (including a school sports circle) or a sports education programme when accompanied by respective supervisors.

description:
Hungary, March 8, 2021:
The National Government prompts economic actors to make use of the legal institution of home working in the operation of their business.
The policy is slated to end on March 22, 2021. UPDATE: The policy was repealed on May 10, 2021.

description:
Hungary, May 23, 2021:
The National Government declares that accommodation providers have to shut their doors for all individuals except persons employed there, persons staying there for business, economic or educational reasons, persons belonging to the Hungarian Defence Forces or law enforcement agencies staying there for the purpose of performing their official duties, seconded health care workers and those protected against the coronavirus (that is, having an immunity certificate as per section 1/A of Government Decree 484/2020 as of May 23, 2021) as well as persons under the age of eighteen years who are under the supervision of protected persons. Employees should wear a mask if not protected against the coronavirus in the areas and places of the accommodation which may be visited by guests. The places referred to in § 12, section 1 of Government Decree 484/2020 (as of May 23, 2021) may, if available in the acc. provider, be visited by guests protected against the coronavirus and those under their supervision. Gambling casinos and card rooms may, if available there, be visited by guests protected against the coronavirus. There are exceptions to these measures for family or private events.
The policy's ending is indefinite.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description:
Hungary, May 23, 2021:
The National Government declares that it is permitted to stay in the garden or terrace of a catering facility and consume ordered food or drinks there. Staying inside of a catering facility and consuming food or drinks there is only allowed for those protected against the coronavirus (that is, having an immunity certificate as per section 1/A of Government Decree 484/2020 as of May 23, 2021) as well as persons under the age of eighteen years who are under the supervision of protected persons. Staying inside of a catering facility is also allowed for the purpose of serving and delivering takeaway food, for the purpose of using a toilet inside of catering facilities, and, where it is not possible to do so in the garden or on the terrace, for the purpose of paying for consumption. This rule does not apply to, for example, workplace restaurants or canteens (see exceptions section). Guests should not wear a mask at catering facilities whenever they are seated at a table, consuming food or drinks when not seated at a table or when located on the patio or terrace of a catering establishment. Employees should wear a mask if not protected against the coronavirus.
The policy's ending is indefinite.

Hungary, May 1, 2021:
The National Government declares that all shops/stores can open if complying with certain security measures (see [type_business_var] variable), such as limiting business hours to between 5 am and 11 pm. Costumers are asked to spend as little time as possible in shops/stores.
The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: From May 23, 2021, business hours are no longer restricted to between 5 am and 11 pm.

description:
Hungary, May 1, 2021:
The National Government declares that accommodation providers have to shut their doors for all individuals except persons employed there, persons staying there for business, economic or educational reasons, persons belonging to the Hungarian Defence Forces or law enforcement agencies staying there for the purpose of performing their official duties, seconded health care workers and those protected against the coronavirus (that is, having an immunity certificate as per section 1/A of Government Decree 484/2020 as of May 1, 2021) as well as persons under the age of eighteen years who are under the supervision of protected persons. Employees should wear a mask if not protected against the coronavirus in the areas and places of the accommodation which may be visited by guests. It is prohibited to organise or hold a musical or dancing event in an accommodation provider. Family or private events may be organised or held in an accommodation provider if the number of persons present at any one time does not exceed ten. The places referred to in § 12, section 1 of Government Decree 484/2020 (as of May 1, 2021) may, if available in the acc. provider, be visited by guests protected against the coronavirus and those under their supervision. Gambling casinos and card rooms may, if available there, be visited by guests protected against the coronavirus.
The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: From May 23, 2021, it is no longer prohibited to organise or hold music and dance events within accommodation providers. Family or private events held within accommodation providers are no longer numerically restricted.

description:
Hungary, May 1, 2021:
The National Government declares that, between 5 am and 11 pm, it is permitted to stay in the garden or terrace of a catering facility and consume ordered food or drinks there. Staying inside of a catering facility and consuming food or drinks there is, at this time, only allowed for those protected against the coronavirus (that is, having an immunity certificate as per section 1/A of Government Decree 484/2020 as of May 1, 2021) as well as persons under the age of eighteen years who are under the supervision of protected persons. Staying inside of a catering facility is also allowed for the purpose of serving and delivering takeaway food, for the purpose of using a toilet inside of catering facilities, and, where it is not possible to do so in the garden or on the terrace, for the purpose of paying for consumption. This rule does not apply to, for example, workplace restaurants or canteens (see exceptions section). It is prohibited to organise or hold a musical or dancing event in a catering facility. Family or private events may be organised or held in a catering facility if the number of persons present at any one time does not exceed ten. Guests should not wear a mask at catering facilities whenever they are seated at a table, consuming food or drinks when not seated at a table or when located on the patio or terrace of a catering establishment. Employees should wear a mask if not protected against the coronavirus.
The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: From May 23, 2021, it is permitted to stay in the garden or terrace of a catering facility and consume ordered food or drinks there at all times. It is no longer prohibited to organise or hold music and dance events in catering facilities. Family or private events held in catering facilities are no longer numerically restricted.

The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: The policy ended on July 3, 2021.

description:
Hungary, May 23, 2021:
The National Government declares that accommodation providers have to shut their doors for all individuals except persons employed there, persons staying there for business, economic or educational reasons, persons belonging to the Hungarian Defence Forces or law enforcement agencies staying there for the purpose of performing their official duties, seconded health care workers and those protected against the coronavirus (that is, having an immunity certificate as per section 1/A of Government Decree 484/2020 as of May 23, 2021) as well as persons under the age of eighteen years who are under the supervision of protected persons. Employees should wear a mask if not protected against the coronavirus in the areas and places of the accommodation which may be visited by guests. The places referred to in § 12, section 1 of Government Decree 484/2020 (as of May 23, 2021) may, if available in the acc. provider, be visited by guests protected against the coronavirus and those under their supervision. Gambling casinos and card rooms may, if available there, be visited by guests protected against the coronavirus. There are exceptions to these measures for family or private events.
The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: The policy ended on July 3, 2021.

description:
Hungary, May 23, 2021:
The National Government declares that cinemas, zoos, wildlife parks, adventure parks, amusement parks and playhouses may be visited by those protected against the coronavirus (that is, having an immunity certificate as per section 1/A of Government Decree 484/2020 as of May 23, 2021) as well as persons under the age of eighteen years who are under the supervision of protected persons. Ice rinks, swimming pools, gyms, fitness centres and sports facilities may be visited by competitive athletes under the age of eighteen, their coaches, children or pupils in the context of a physical education class, a sports club (including a school sports circle) or a sports education programme when accompanied by respective supervisors, or persons protected against the coronavirus. Employees should wear a mask if not protected against the coronavirus in the areas and places open to visitors.
The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: The policy ended on July 3, 2021.

description:
Hungary, March 18, 2020:
As per 'AboutHungary', "in the interest of preventing the spread of the coronavirus, government and document offices will only receive customers by appointment from [the abovementioned date]. It is no longer possible to take a number at government windows and document offices; administration of affairs is only possible by prior appointment. At the customer service points of government offices and district offices, the number of customers allowed on the customer service premises at any one time must be limited. [C]ustomers are requested to wait outside the customer service premises, maintaining 'a social distance' of minimum 1.5 to 2 meters from one another."
The source doesn't mention an end date.

description:
Hungary, March 31, 2020:
The Hungarian Parliament adopts "Act XII of 2020 on the containment of coronavirus" which, among other things, states that no by-elections may be called until the day following the end of the period of state of danger; the elections already called shall not be held (the elections not called or not held shall be called within fifteen days of the end of the period of state of danger). Also, no national and local referendums may be initiated until the day following the end of the period of state of danger; the national and local referendums already called shall not be held (the national and local referendums not called or not held shall be called within fifteen days of the end of the period of state of danger).
Repeal of this Act shall be decided by the National Assembly upon the end of the period of state of danger (which is indefinite).

description:
Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that public museums, public libraries, public cultural institutions and community theatres are to be closed for visitors. Additionally, wearing a mask is mandatory in public archives and public administration facilities (where there are regularly more than 5 persons at any one time). Minors under the age of six are exempted from the obligation to wear a mask.
The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020.

description:
Hungary, November 6, 2020:
The National Government declares that no by-elections may be called until the day following the end of the period of state of danger; the elections already called shall not be held (the elections not called or not held shall be called within fifteen days of the end of the period of state of danger). Also, no national and local referendums may be initiated until the day following the end of the period of state of danger; the national and local referendums already called shall not be held (the national and local referendums not called or not held shall be called within fifteen days of the end of the period of state of danger).
This policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends (which is indefinite). UPDATE: As Government Decree 483/2020 was replaced by "Act CIX of 2020 on the containment of the second wave of the coronavirus pandemic" on November 11, 2020, this policy is slated to end on the 90th day following the promulgation of Act CIX of 2020, that is, February 7, 2021.

update_level_var: [compliance] of policy relaxing ; timing of policy strengthening
description:
Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that public museums, public libraries, public cultural institutions and community theatres are to be closed for visitors. Additionally, wearing a mask is mandatory in public archives and public administration facilities (where there are regularly more than 5 persons at any one time). Minors under the age of six are exempted from the obligation to wear a mask.
The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020. UPDATE: From January 30, 2021, public museums, public libraries, public cultural institutions and community theatres may be visited for the purpose of providing vocational training, where the participants and instructors may remain for the duration of the training. Also, the policy is extended until March 1, 2021.

description:
Hungary, November 6, 2020:
The National Government declares that no by-elections may be called until the day following the end of the period of state of danger; the elections already called shall not be held (the elections not called or not held shall be called within fifteen days of the end of the period of state of danger). Also, no national and local referendums may be initiated until the day following the end of the period of state of danger; the national and local referendums already called shall not be held (the national and local referendums not called or not held shall be called within fifteen days of the end of the period of state of danger).
This policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends (which is indefinite). UPDATE: The policy ended on February 7, 2021, as scheduled in Act CIX of 2020 (2020. évi CIX. törvény) as of November 11, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
institution_cat: No information in the policy about whether the government service is considered essential or non-essential
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description:
Hungary, February 13, 2021:
The Government Office of the Capital of Budapest is issuing immunity certificates which prove protection against the coronavirus either through recovery from a COVID-19 disease or 'full' vaccination with (an) authorised COVID-19 vaccine(s).
The policy's ending is indefinite.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

Additionally, wearing a mask is mandatory in public archives and public administration facilities (where there are regularly more than 5 persons at any one time). Minors under the age of six are exempted from the obligation to wear a mask.
The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020. UPDATE: From April 16, 2021, this policy is extended indefinitely.

description:
Hungary, May 1, 2021:
The National Government declares that public museums, public libraries, public cultural institutions and community theatres may only be visited by persons protected against the coronavirus (vaccinated or recovered) and persons under the age of eighteen who are under the supervision of a protected person. Additionally, wearing a mask is mandatory in public archives and public administration facilities (where there are regularly more than 5 persons at any one time). The policy's ending is indefinite.

description:
Hungary, February 13, 2021:
The Government Office of the Capital of Budapest is issuing immunity certificates which prove protection against the coronavirus either through recovery from a COVID-19 disease or 'full' vaccination with (an) authorised COVID-19 vaccine(s).
The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: From May 2, 2021, the faking/falsification of immunity certificates is, among other things, considered an offence with imprisonment of up to five years. This policy is slated to end on May 23, 2021.

description:
Hungary, March 12, 2020:
The National Government enacts that the holding of an event with more than 100 persons in an enclosed place and more than 500 persons in an unenclosed place is prohibited.
The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: From March 17, 2020, it is prohibited to stay at the venue of an event regardless of the number of participants and whether its indoors or outdoors. Staying at the place of an assembly is also prohibited. Religious community services, civil marriages and funerals may be exempted. There are fines for violating these rules. Police will enforce compliance.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Other mass gatherings not specified above restricted
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)
enforcer: National Government,Military,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Hungary, May 4, 2020:
The National Government declares that religious community ceremonies, civil marriages and funerals may be exempted from event restrictions as long as protective distance measures are followed (marriage ceremonies need not to). This policy covers the whole of Hungary with the exception of Budapest and Pest County. The policy's ending is indefinite.

description:
Hungary, May 28, 2020:
The National Government declares that it is prohibited to stay at the venue of an indoor event regardless of the number of participants. Staying at the place of an assembly is also prohibited. Religious community services, civil marriages and funerals may be exempted. Outdoor events as defined in § 2 of Government Decree 241/2020 may be held under certain circumstances (see [type_mass_var]). Outdoor music and dance events are still prohibited. The policy's ending is indefinite.

description:
Hungary, October 23, 2020:
The National Government declares that music and dance events may be held if the number of persons present at the event venue at any one time, including the persons employed there, does not exceed 500 persons. It is prohibited to be present at the place of an event from 23:00 to 06:00 o'clock, except for persons employed there. At sporting events and public assemblies, everyone has to wear a mask (except athletes, coaches, referees, umpires and their assistants as well as the speaker of the assembly for the duration of the speech).
The policy's ending is indefinite.

The National Government declares that events which provide music as a main service and where it is not necessary to have a reserved seat in order to attend are banned without exception (whether public or non-public, by means of a selected record performance or live performance, held regularly or on a specific occasion or at a specific time). The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: From November 11, 2020, live musical performances may be held if only attended by performers and technical staff indispensable for its organisation.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Other mass gatherings not specified above restricted
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Fines

description:
Hungary, November 4, 2020:
The National Government declares that cultural or sporting events as per § 3, section 1 of Government Decree 479/2020 may be held if specific safety measures are met (see [type_mass_var]). The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: From November 11, 2020, sports events may only be held in closed conditions without spectators.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Other mass gatherings not specified above restricted
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that family events or private events, with the exception of marriage ceremonies and funerals, may only be held if the number of persons present at the same time does not exceed ten. The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020. description:
Hungary, May 1, 2021:
The National Government declares that sporting events may be held no later than 11 pm with the attendance of spectators if the latter can prove protection against the coronavirus or are persons below the age of eighteen under the supervision of protected persons. Employees (excluding competitors and the sports staff who train them) who cannot prove immunity against the coronavirus are obliged to wear a mask until the end of the sporting event. Spectators are not obliged to wear a mask. Another government decree may lay down rules that differ from this policy. The policy's ending is indefinite.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Other mass gatherings not specified above restricted
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: People who are neither vaccinated nor recovered from COVID-19
compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)

description:
Hungary, May 1, 2021:
The National Government declares that ticketed cultural events (including live musical performances) may be held between 5 am and 11 pm with the attendance of spectators if the latter can prove protection against the coronavirus or are persons below the age of eighteen under the supervision of protected persons. Between 11 pm and 5 am, only employees shall be present at the venue of a cultural event. Employees (excluding performers) who cannot prove immunity against the coronavirus are obliged to wear a mask until the end of the cultural event. Spectators are not obliged to wear a mask. The policy's ending is indefinite.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Other mass gatherings not specified above restricted
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: People who are neither vaccinated nor recovered from COVID-19
compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)

description:
Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that sports events may only be held in closed conditions without spectators. The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020. UPDATE: From May 1, 2021, persons protected against the coronavirus and persons under the age of eighteen who are under the supervision of protected persons may attend a sporting event as spectators if the sporting event is held no later than 11 pm.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Other mass gatherings not specified above restricted
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)

Hungary, November 11, 2020:

The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020. UPDATE: From May 1, 2021, persons protected against the coronavirus and persons under the age of eighteen who are under the supervision of protected persons may attend a ticketed cultural event (including live musical performances) as spectators from 5 am to 11 pm.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Other mass gatherings not specified above restricted

description:
Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that events which provide music as a main service and are held on a regular basis or on a fixed occasion or at a fixed time are banned (whether public or non-public) with the exception of online live musical performances. The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020. UPDATE: From May 23, 2021, music and dance events may be held in accordance with security provisions such as only allowing attendants who are protected against the coronavirus or wear a mask.

description:
Hungary, May 1, 2021:
The National Government declares that ticketed cultural events (including live musical performances) may be held between 5 am and 11 pm with the attendance of spectators if the latter can prove protection against the coronavirus or are persons below the age of eighteen under the supervision of protected persons. Between 11 pm and 5 am, only employees shall be present at the venue of a cultural event. Employees (excluding performers) who cannot prove immunity against the coronavirus are obliged to wear a mask until the end of the cultural event. Spectators are not obliged to wear a mask. The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: From May 23, 2021, ticketed cultural events (including live musical performances) with the attendance of spectators may be held at any time of the day.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

Employees (excluding competitors and the sports staff who train them) who cannot prove immunity against the coronavirus are obliged to wear a mask until the end of the sporting event. The National Government declares that family events or private events, with the exception of marriage ceremonies and funerals, may only be held if the number of persons present at the same time does not exceed ten. The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020. UPDATE: The policy was repealed on March 7, 2022.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Other mass gatherings not specified above restricted
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry),Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)

description:
Hungary, May 23, 2021:
The National Government declares that marriage ceremonies may only be held if the number of persons present at the same time (excluding the persons employed there) does not exceed 200. The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: The policy was repealed on March 7, 2022.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Hungary, March 18, 2020:
As per 'AboutHungary', "in the interest of preventing the spread of the coronavirus, government and document offices will only receive customers by appointment from [the abovementioned date]. It is no longer possible to take a number at government windows and document offices; administration of affairs is only possible by prior appointment. At the customer service points of government offices and district offices, the number of customers allowed on the customer service premises at any one time must be limited. [C]ustomers are requested to wait outside the customer service premises, maintaining 'a social distance' of minimum 1.5 to 2 meters from one another."
The source doesn't mention an end date.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Other government service not specified above
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Hungary, April 4, 2020:
The National Government declares that postal deliveries to addresses temporarily designated as quarantine places can only be done by means of a letter box. If that's not possible, the mail shall, for the time being, be kept at the disposal of a person not subject to quarantine if expressly requested so by the addressee. In non-quarantine cases, postal service providers may deliver registered mail by means of a letter box or, if identity checks are necessary, from a distance of about 1.5 metres to the addressee without taking a signature.
The policy is slated to end alongside the state of emergency.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Other Businesses
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description:
Hungary, April 6, 2020:
Prime Minister Viktor Orbán declares that public parking is, from this date, free of charge nation-wide to encourage people to use less public transport, by using their cars. He explained this decision with keeping safe distances, "[...] [which] is impossible or only possible to a limited degree on crowded public transport vehicles [...]".
The policy's ending is indefinite.

description:
Hungary, April 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that, during a final examination for higher education students, it shall be ensured that no personal contact between the examinee and other persons is required, and a distance of at least 1.5 metres is maintained between persons. Also, there is now a two-person final examination committee instead of a three-person one, "'thus reducing the risk of spreading infection[s]', said [State Secretary] Tamás Schanda". The latter also applies to final examination committees for doctoral students provided that a final examination committee may not have less than 2 members here.
The policy is slated to end alongside the state of emergency.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Hungary, April 17, 2020:
The National Government declares that this year's school-leaving exams will be held under changed conditions and with several precautions. Between May 4 and 21, only written exams will be organised. The exams in the major subjects will start at 9 instead of 8 am in order to avoid that students travel at the same time as those leaving for work. There will be a maximum of ten students per classroom and a distance of at least 1,5 metres will be maintained. There will be compulsory disinfection in all buildings and, if required but not compulsory, students and teachers will be provided with masks. If necessary, any classroom of any public education institution will be used as a venue for examinations.
Furthermore, only five subjects will be subject to oral examinations: Cultural studies, biblical studies, Judaism, folk art and religious studies. Sports will have oral examinations only. Because of the current restrictions on mass gatherings, graduation ceremonies cannot be held.
The policy is a one-time measure.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description:
Hungary, May 4, 2020:
The National Government declares that, except for those employed there, it is forbidden to stay in a catering facility. This shall not apply to takeaway and delivery of food. However, it is permitted to stay in the garden or terrace of a catering facility, in particular a restaurant, café, confectionery, buffet, or press bar, and to consume the food or drink ordered, provided that social distancing measures are followed. If the terrace of a catering facility is located in a public area, operators shall not be required to pay the public area use fee until September 1, 2020. This policy applies to all of Hungary except for Budapest and Pest county. The policy ends alongside the state of emergency.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Restaurants
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
compliance: Mandatory with Fines

description:
Hungary, March 28, 2020:
The National Government declares that, between 9 and 12 am, grocery stores, drugstores, markets or pharmacies may only be visited by persons who have attained the age of 65 years. The policy is slated to end on April 11, 2020. UPDATE: From May 4, 2020, "shops selling medicines or medical devices" are also obliged to follow this policy. Ensuring the availability of exclusive business hours for persons over 65 years of age at markets is now the responsibility of municipal governments. These policy changes affect all of Hungary except for Budapest and Pest county.

description:
Hungary, March 28, 2020:
The National Government declares that, between 9 and 12 am, grocery stores, drugstores, markets or pharmacies may only be visited by persons who have attained the age of 65 years. The policy is slated to end on April 11, 2020. UPDATE: From May 4, 2020, "shops selling medicines or medical devices" are also obliged to follow this policy. Ensuring the availability of exclusive business hours for persons over 65 years of age at markets is now the responsibility of municipal governments. These policy changes affect all of Hungary except for Budapest and Pest county.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Supermarkets/grocery stores
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: People of a certain age (please note age range in the text entry)

description:
Hungary, March 28, 2020:
The National Government declares that, except for those employed there, it is forbidden to stay in a catering facility. This shall not apply to takeaway and delivery of food. The policy is slated to end on April 11, 2020. UPDATE: From May 4, 2020, it is permitted to stay in the garden or terrace of a catering facility, in particular a restaurant, café, confectionery, buffet, or press bar, and to consume the food or drink ordered, provided that social distancing measures are followed. If the terrace of a catering facility is located in a public area, operators shall not be required to pay the public area use fee until September 1, 2020. This policy change affects all of Hungary except for Budapest and Pest county.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Restaurants
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Fines

description:
Hungary, May 17, 2020:
The National Government declares that, except for those employed there, it is forbidden to stay in a catering facility. This shall not apply to takeaway and delivery of food. However, it is permitted to stay in the garden or terrace of a catering facility, in particular a restaurant, café, confectionery, buffet, or press bar, and to consume the food or drink ordered, provided that social distancing measures are followed. If the terrace of a catering facility is located in a public area, operators shall not be required to pay the public area use fee until September 1, 2020. Catering facilities are not allowed the use of equipment with internal air circulation. This policy applies to all of Hungary except for Budapest and Pest county. The policy ends alongside the state of emergency.

description:
Hungary, May 4, 2020:
The National Government declares that, except for those employed there, it is forbidden to stay in a catering facility. This shall not apply to takeaway and delivery of food. However, it is permitted to stay in the garden or terrace of a catering facility, in particular a restaurant, café, confectionery, buffet, or press bar, and to consume the food or drink ordered, provided that social distancing measures are followed. description:
Hungary, May 18, 2020:
The National Government declares that the serving of food and drinks inside of a catering facility is allowed if employees wear a face mask in the areas accessible to customers and social distancing measures are followed. It is also permitted to stay in the garden or terrace of a catering facility and to consume the food or drink ordered, provided that social distancing measures are followed. If the terrace of a catering facility is located in a public area, operators shall not be required to pay the public area use fee until September 1, 2020. Catering facilities are not allowed the use of equipment with internal air circulation. This policy applies to all of Hungary except for Budapest. The policy ends alongside the state of emergency.

description:
Hungary, May 17, 2020:
The National Government declares that, except for those employed there, it is forbidden to stay in a catering facility. This shall not apply to takeaway and delivery of food. However, it is permitted to stay in the garden or terrace of a catering facility, in particular a restaurant, café, confectionery, buffet, or press bar, and to consume the food or drink ordered, provided that social distancing measures are followed. If the terrace of a catering facility is located in a public area, operators shall not be required to pay the public area use fee until September 1, 2020. Catering facilities are not allowed the use of equipment with internal air circulation. This policy applies to all of Hungary except for Budapest and Pest county. The policy ends alongside the state of emergency. UPDATE: From May 18, 2020, this policy also affects Pest county. The serving of food and drinks inside of a catering facility is now allowed if employees wear a face mask in the areas accessible to customers and social distancing measures are followed.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Restaurants
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
compliance: Mandatory with Fines

description:
Hungary, May 17, 2020:
The National Government declares that, except for those employed there, it is forbidden to stay in a catering facility. This shall not apply to takeaway and delivery of food. Catering facilities are not allowed the use of equipment with internal air circulation. This policy applies to Budapest and Pest county only. The policy ends alongside the state of emergency. Social distancing and face covering measures need to be followed (the former in general) here. The policy ends alongside the state of emergency. UPDATE: This policy expired on June 17, 2020, alongside the state of emergency.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: People of a certain age (please note age range in the text entry)

description:
Hungary, April 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that, during a final examination for higher education students, it shall be ensured that no personal contact between the examinee and other persons is required, and a distance of at least 1.5 metres is maintained between persons. Also, there is now a two-person final examination committee instead of a three-person one, "'thus reducing the risk of spreading infection[s]', said [State Secretary] Tamás Schanda".
The policy is slated to end alongside the state of emergency. UPDATE: The policy ended on June 17, 2020, as the state of emergency ended on that day.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Hungary, April 4, 2020:
The National Government declares that postal deliveries to addresses temporarily designated as quarantine places can only be done by means of a letter box. If that's not possible, the mail shall, for the time being, be kept at the disposal of a person not subject to quarantine if expressly requested so by the addressee. In non-quarantine cases, postal service providers may deliver registered mail by means of a letter box or, if identity checks are necessary, from a distance of about 1.5 metres to the addressee without taking a signature.
The policy is slated to end alongside the state of emergency. UPDATE: The policy ended on June 17, 2020, as the state of emergency ended on that day.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Other Businesses
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description: As part of the emergency decree issued by the Hungarian Government on March 28, 2020, everyone must restrict social distances – with the exception of persons living in the same household – to the highest possible extent and keep if possible at least 1.5 m distance from the other person. UPDATE: This policy expired on June 17, 2020, alongside of the state of emergency.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
Hungary, May 29, 2020:
The National Government declares that the serving of food and drinks inside of a catering facility is allowed if employees wear a face mask in the areas accessible to customers and social distancing measures are followed. It is also permitted to stay in the garden or terrace of a catering facility and to consume the food or drink ordered, provided that social distancing measures are followed. If the terrace of a catering facility is located in a public area, operators shall not be required to pay the public area use fee until September 1, 2020. Catering facilities are not allowed the use of equipment with internal air circulation. The policy ends alongside the state of emergency. UPDATE: From June 18, 2020, all rules are dropped except for the one that employees working in the interior (closed) part of a catering facility, in areas frequented by customers, must wear a device covering the mouth and nose (e.g. medical mask, scarf, bandana).
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Restaurants
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Fines

description:
Hungary, April 6, 2020:
Prime Minister Viktor Orbán declares that public parking is, from this date, free of charge nation-wide to encourage people to use less public transport, by using their cars. He explained this decision with keeping safe distances, "[...] [which] is impossible or only possible to a limited degree on crowded public transport vehicles [...]".
The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: The measure was repealed on July 2, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on ridership of subways and trams
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

Hungary, September 7, 2020:
The National Chief Medical Officer has ordered a ban on leaving all social institutions that provide specialised care. There are exceptions such as that the ban on leaving institutions is not applicable to night shelters and temporary accommodation for the homeless.
The policy's ending is indefinite.

description:
Hungary, September 8, 2020:
As per HungaryToday, Hungary’s chief medical officer has ordered a nationwide ban on visits to hospitals. The ban [...] applies to both public and private institutions. The restrictions do not apply in the cases of severely or terminally ill patients. [O]ne parent is also allowed to stay at the hospital with their child and women due to give birth may also choose someone to accompany them.
The policy's ending is indefinite.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: On June 12 (announced on June 13), following the lifting of the total ban on hospital visitations, the Chief Medical Officer of Hungary introduced a number of restrictions with regards to hospital visitations: Visitors must be healthy, wear masks, wash and sanitize their hands, and keep a distance of at least 2 meters from all patients other than the ones visited. UPDATE: From September 8, 2020, Hungary’s chief medical officer has re-introduced a nationwide ban on visits to hospitals.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description: Passengers using public transport in Budapest will have to wear a mask or cover their face with a scarf as of April 27, 2020, except minors aged under 6. The municipal regulation on masks will also apply to people while shopping or travelling in a taxi. UPDATE: Budapest tightens regulations on wearing masks in public spaces as of September 15, 2020. Wearing masks will be compulsory in cinemas, theatres, concerts, circuses, and at similar indoor events, as well as during meetings of residents in apartment blocks. If masks are not worn properly or at all, violators face an on-the-spot fine of up to 8,000 forints or an administrative fine of up to 15,000 forints.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description:
Hungary, June 18, 2020:
The National Government declares that employees working in the interior (closed) parts of a catering facility, in areas frequented by customers, must wear a device covering their mouth and nose (e.g. medical mask, scarf, bandana). The policy's ending is indefinite.
 UPDATE: From September 21, 2020, catering facilities may receive guests from 6 am to 11 pm only, with the exception of takeaway orders.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: Other workers where the distinction between essential or non-essential is not explictely made (please note the occupation in the text entry)
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description:
Hungary, May 18, 2020:
The National Government declares that everyone is required to wear a mask covering the mouth and nose when on public transport. The policy is slated to end whenever the state of emergency ends. UPDATE: From September 21, 2020, a face mask also needs to be worn in all premises where persons are waiting for public transport, the premises of public places of entertainment, public archives, areas of the public administration, the premises of a health care establishment and in a social institution (see § 1 of Government Decree 431/2020).
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
Hungary, September 21, 2020:
The National Government declares that catering facilities may receive guests from 6 am to 11 pm only. Outside of this time frame, only employees may stay in catering facilities and takeaway orders are permitted. Except for the guests of a catering facility, individuals have to wear a mask. In office or business areas within catering facilities, face covering rules do not apply. The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: From October 3, 2020, fines or the closing of premises/businesses may be imposed in the event of non-compliance with these rules.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry),Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)

description:
Hungary, September 21, 2020:
The National Government declares that all individuals are obliged to wear a device covering the mouth and nose (e.g. medical mask, scarf, bandana) inside of a shop, on the premises of a shopping centre (excluding office areas and premises used for sports and business purposes) and in cinemas (excluding office and business areas). Minors under the age of six are exempted. The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: From October 3, 2020, fines or the closing of premises/businesses may be imposed in the event of non-compliance with these rules.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Hungary, October 10, 2020:
The National Government declares that casinos and card rooms may receive guests from 6 am to 11 pm only. Outside of this time frame, only employees, representatives of the operator and persons performing technical tasks may be present there. The policy's ending is indefinite.

description:
Hungary, September 21, 2020:
The National Government declares that, in public museums, public libraries, public archives, public cultural institutions, community theatres, public administration facilities (where there are regularly more than 5 persons at any one time), everyone, with the exception of minors under the age of six, is obliged to wear a mask.
The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: From October 10, 2020, the municipal level is no longer mentioned as an enforcer of this policy.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: People of a certain age (please note age range in the text entry)

description:
Hungary, September 21, 2020:
The National Government declares that catering facilities may receive guests from 6 am to 11 pm only. Outside of this time frame, only employees may stay in catering facilities and takeaway orders are permitted. Except for the guests of a catering facility, individuals have to wear a mask. In office or business areas within catering facilities, face covering rules do not apply. The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: From November 2, 2020, guests of a catering facility are no longer exempted from wearing a mask. They have to do so whenever not sitting at a table or not consuming food/drinks.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Hungary, September 21, 2020:
The National Government declares that, in public museums, public libraries, public archives, public cultural institutions, community theatres, public administration facilities (where there are regularly more than 5 persons at any one time), everyone, with the exception of minors under the age of six, is obliged to wear a mask.
The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: From November 2, 2020, if a catering activity is carried out in the places referred to in the original entry, the mask need not be worn in the area of the venue set up for the serving of food or drinks for the duration of the consumption of food and drinks purchased there.

description:
Hungary, November 4, 2020:
The National Government declares that, in public museums, public libraries, public archives, public cultural institutions, community theatres, public administration facilities (where there are regularly more than 5 persons at any one time), everyone, with the exception of minors under the age of six, are obliged to wear a mask. Additionally, public museums, public libraries, public archives, public cultural institutions and community theatres may only be visited if a person-to-person minimum distance of 1,5 metres is maintained.
The policy's ending is indefinite.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Public libraries

description:
Hungary, November 4, 2020:
The National Government declares that, in order to reduce the spread of the SARS-CoV-2 virus, local public transport operators in Budapest and in cities with county rights shall prepare a frequency/flight screening plan for the reduction of the number of flights for the periods between 7 am and 9 am and between 3 pm and 7 pm on working days, which is to be approved by Government Offices. Upon approval, respective flight screening plans are to be implemented immediately.
The policy's ending is indefinite.

The National Government declares that, in public museums, public libraries, public archives, public cultural institutions, community theatres, public administration facilities (where there are regularly more than 5 persons at any one time), everyone, with the exception of minors under the age of six, is obliged to wear a mask.
The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: From November 4, 2020, public museums, public libraries, public archives, public cultural institutions and community theatres may only be visited if a person-to-person minimum distance of 1,5 metres is maintained.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Other public facilities
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: People of a certain age (please note age range in the text entry)
compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry),Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)

description:
Hungary, October 10, 2020:
The National Government declares that casinos and card rooms may receive guests from 6 am to 11 pm only. Outside of this time frame, only employees, representatives of the operator and persons performing technical tasks may be present there. The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: The policy ended on November 10, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry),Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)

description:
Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that shops (including lotteries and national tobacconist's shops) have to shut their doors from 7 pm to 5 am. Within this time frame, only employees may be present there. Pharmacies and petrol stations are exempted. 
During business hours, all individuals are obliged to wear a face mask inside of a shop and on the premises of a shopping centre (with respect to the latter, excluding office areas and premises used for sports and business purposes). Minors under the age of six are exempted from the obligation to wear a mask. 
Out-of-store/off-premises commercial activities may be allowed as per § 15 of Government Decree 484/2020.
The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry),Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)

description:
Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that staying in a catering facility is only allowed for employees and guests ordering takeaway food. Exceptions apply to: Restaurants or canteens at the workplace; restaurants or bars in a place of accommodation if only serving the guests of the accommodation; canteens or canteen-service bars of a public educational establishment or a vocational training establishment if only serving employees or pupils of the educational establishment; and restaurants or canteens in a health care establishment.
Inside of a catering facility, all individuals have to wear a mask, except minors under the age of six.
Out-of-store/off-premises commercial activities may be allowed as per § 15 of Government Decree 484/2020.
The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that accommodation providers have to shut their doors for all individuals except persons employed there, persons staying there for business, economic or educational reasons, persons belonging to the Hungarian Defence Forces or law enforcement agencies staying there for the purpose of performing their official duties, as well as seconded health care workers. The places referred to in § 12, section 1 of Government Decree 484/2020 shall, if available, be closed. Within catering establishments of accommodation providers, all individuals have to wear a mask.
The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that public museums, public libraries, public cultural institutions and community theatres are to be closed for visitors. Additionally, wearing a mask is mandatory in public archives and public administration facilities (where there are regularly more than 5 persons at any one time). Minors under the age of six are exempted from the obligation to wear a mask.
The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020.

description: Hungary introduced mandatory mask-wearing in “certain public areas” of cities with more than ten thousand inhabitants as of November 11, 2020. Local mayors can decide about how to interpret the term “certain public areas” in their own municipalities and designate the areas where masks are mandatory. During sports, as well as in parks and green areas, masks are still not mandatory.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description:
Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that everyone, except for minors under the age of six (additional exceptions apply), is required to wear a mask covering the mouth and nose when on public transport, in a premise waiting for public transport, public archives, areas of the public administration, the premises of a health care establishment and in a social institution (see § 1 of Government Decree 484/2020). The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020.

description:
Hungary, September 21, 2020:
The National Government declares that all individuals are obliged to wear a device covering the mouth and nose (e.g. medical mask, scarf, bandana) inside of a shop, on the premises of a shopping centre (excluding office areas and premises used for sports and business purposes) and in cinemas (excluding office and business areas). Minors under the age of six are exempted. The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: From November 11, 2020, shops (including lotteries and national tobacconist's shops) have to shut their doors from 7 pm to 5 am. Within this time frame, only employees may be present there. Pharmacies and petrol stations are exempted. Cinemas must close.

description:
Hungary, September 21, 2020:
The National Government declares that catering facilities may receive guests from 6 am to 11 pm only. Outside of this time frame, only employees may stay in catering facilities and takeaway orders are permitted. Except for the guests of a catering facility, individuals have to wear a mask. In office or business areas within catering facilities, face covering rules do not apply. The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: From November 11, 2020, staying in a catering facility is only allowed for employees and guests ordering takeaway food, with the exception of restaurants or canteens at the workplace, restaurants or bars in a place of accommodation if only serving the guests of the accommodation, canteens or canteen-service bars of a public educational establishment or a vocational training establishment if only serving employees or pupils of the educational establishment, and restaurants or canteens in a health care establishment.

description:
Hungary, November 4, 2020:
The National Government declares that, in public museums, public libraries, public archives, public cultural institutions, community theatres, public administration facilities (where there are regularly more than 5 persons at any one time), everyone, with the exception of minors under the age of six, are obliged to wear a mask. Additionally, public museums, public libraries, public archives, public cultural institutions and community theatres may only be visited if a person-to-person minimum distance of 1,5 metres is maintained.
The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: From November 11, 2020, Government Decrees 431/2020 and 479/2020 are, in terms of the present policy, replaced by Government Decree 484/2020 which, among other things, states that public museums and libraries are to be closed.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Public libraries
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry),Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)

description:
Hungary, September 21, 2020:
The National Government declares that everyone, except for minors under the age of six (additional exceptions apply), is required to wear a mask covering the mouth and nose when on public transport, in a premise waiting for public transport, in the premises of public places of entertainment, public archives, areas of the public administration, the premises of a health care establishment and in a social institution (see § 1 of Government Decree 431/2020). The policy's ending is indefinite. UPDATE: From November 11, 2020, individuals are obliged to wear a mask in the internal area of a municipality with a population of more than 10 000 inhabitants, specifically in public places designated by the municipality. The obligation to wear a mask no longer applies to the premises of public places of entertainment.

description:
Hungary, November 24, 2020:
The National Government declares that shops (including lotteries and national tobacconist's shops) have to shut their doors from 7 pm to 5 am. Within this time frame, only employees may be present there. Pharmacies and petrol stations are exempted.
On weekdays between 9 and 11 am and at weekends between 8 and 10 am, only persons who are 65 years of age or older are allowed to visit grocery stores, drugstores and pharmacies.
During business hours, all individuals are obliged to wear a face mask inside of a shop and on the premises of a shopping centre (with respect to the latter, excluding office areas and premises used for sports and business purposes). Minors under the age of six and persons with an autism spectrum disorder are exempted from the obligation to wear a mask.
Out-of-store/off-premises commercial activities may be allowed as per § 15 of Government Decree 484/2020 (as of November 24, 2020).
The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020.

description:
Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that staying in a catering facility is only allowed for employees and guests ordering takeaway food. Exceptions apply to: Restaurants or canteens at the workplace; restaurants or bars in a place of accommodation if only serving the guests of the accommodation; canteens or canteen-service bars of a public educational establishment or a vocational training establishment if only serving employees or pupils of the educational establishment; and restaurants or canteens in a health care establishment.
Inside of a catering facility, all individuals have to wear a mask, except minors under the age of six.
Out-of-store/off-premises commercial activities may be allowed as per § 15 of Government Decree 484/2020.
The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020. UPDATE: From November 26, 2020, persons with an intellectual or psychosocial disability outside of the autism spectrum disorder are also exempted from the obligation to wear a mask.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that accommodation providers have to shut their doors for all individuals except persons employed there, persons staying there for business, economic or educational reasons, persons belonging to the Hungarian Defence Forces or law enforcement agencies staying there for the purpose of performing their official duties, as well as seconded health care workers. The places referred to in § 12, section 1 of Government Decree 484/2020 shall, if available, be closed. Within catering establishments of accommodation providers, all individuals have to wear a mask.
The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020. UPDATE: From November 26, 2020, persons with an intellectual or psychosocial disability outside of the autism spectrum disorder are also exempted from the obligation to wear a mask.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that public museums, public libraries, public cultural institutions and community theatres are to be closed for visitors. Additionally, wearing a mask is mandatory in public archives and public administration facilities (where there are regularly more than 5 persons at any one time). Minors under the age of six are exempted from the obligation to wear a mask.
The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020. UPDATE: From November 26, 2020, persons with an intellectual or psychosocial disability outside of the autism spectrum disorder are also exempted from the obligation to wear a mask.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that everyone, except for minors under the age of six (additional exceptions apply), is required to wear a mask covering the mouth and nose when on public transport, in a premise waiting for public transport, public archives, areas of the public administration, the premises of a health care establishment and in a social institution (see § 1 of Government Decree 484/2020). The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020. UPDATE: From November 26, 2020, persons with an intellectual or psychosocial disability outside of the autism spectrum disorder are also exempted from the obligation to wear a mask.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
Hungary, November 24, 2020:
The National Government declares that shops (including lotteries and national tobacconist's shops) have to shut their doors from 7 pm to 5 am. Within this time frame, only employees may be present there. Pharmacies and petrol stations are exempted.
On weekdays between 9 and 11 am and at weekends between 8 and 10 am, only persons who are 65 years of age or older are allowed to visit grocery stores, drugstores and pharmacies.
During business hours, all individuals are obliged to wear a face mask inside of a shop and on the premises of a shopping centre (with respect to the latter, excluding office areas and premises used for sports and business purposes). Minors under the age of six and persons with an autism spectrum disorder are exempted from the obligation to wear a mask.
Out-of-store/off-premises commercial activities may be allowed as per § 15 of Government Decree 484/2020 (as of November 24, 2020).
The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020. UPDATE: From December 3, 2020, employees of stores/shops may be granted a break during working hours in which they may refrain from wearing a mask. The break must be located in a room or area which is not used for the storage of products sold in the shop and in which no customer may be present.

During business hours, all individuals are obliged to wear a face mask inside of a shop and on the premises of a shopping centre (with respect to the latter, excluding office areas and premises used for sports and business purposes). Minors under the age of six and persons with an autism spectrum disorder are exempted from the obligation to wear a mask.
Out-of-store/off-premises commercial activities may be allowed as per § 15 of Government Decree 484/2020 (as of November 24, 2020).
The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020. UPDATE: Protected shopping hours for persons who are 65 or older are suspended indefinitely on December 12, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that everyone, except for minors under the age of six (additional exceptions apply), is required to wear a mask covering the mouth and nose when on public transport, in a premise waiting for public transport, public archives, areas of the public administration, the premises of a health care establishment and in a social institution (see § 1 of Government Decree 484/2020). The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020. UPDATE: From December 16, 2020, drivers of a public transport vehicle are not required to wear a mask when in the enclosed cab of a public transport vehicle.

description:
Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that staying in a catering facility is only allowed for employees and guests ordering takeaway food. Exceptions apply to: Restaurants or canteens at the workplace; restaurants or bars in a place of accommodation if only serving the guests of the accommodation; canteens or canteen-service bars of a public educational establishment or a vocational training establishment if only serving employees or pupils of the educational establishment; and restaurants or canteens in a health care establishment.
Inside of a catering facility, all individuals have to wear a mask, except minors under the age of six.
Out-of-store/off-premises commercial activities may be allowed as per § 15 of Government Decree 484/2020.
The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020. UPDATE: From January 9, 2021, this policy is extended until February 1, 2021.

description:
Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that accommodation providers have to shut their doors for all individuals except persons employed there, persons staying there for business, economic or educational reasons, persons belonging to the Hungarian Defence Forces or law enforcement agencies staying there for the purpose of performing their official duties, as well as seconded health care workers. The places referred to in § 12, section 1 of Government Decree 484/2020 shall, if available, be closed. Within catering establishments of accommodation providers, all individuals have to wear a mask.
The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020. UPDATE: From January 9, 2021, this policy is extended until February 1, 2021.

description:
Hungary, January 23, 2021:
The Ministry of Human Resources declares that the central written examinations for high school admission will be held in strict compliance with the proven epidemiological rules already used in the matriculation examinations. In view of the epidemic situation, the exams are being organised in 535 more locations than before. Only students wearing a mask and after having their body temperature measured are allowed to enter the institutions, and no more than 10 students are allowed in a room during the examination. Wearing a protective mask is compulsory for supervising teachers. The organisers should provide an adequate supply of hand sanitiser at each venue and the school districts should also provide protective gloves for teachers involved in the handling and correction of examination papers.
The policy is a one-time measure.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)

description:
Hungary, November 11, 2020:
The National Government declares that staying in a catering facility is only allowed for employees and guests ordering takeaway food. Exceptions apply to: Restaurants or canteens at the workplace; restaurants or bars in a place of accommodation if only serving the guests of the accommodation; canteens or canteen-service bars of a public educational establishment or a vocational training establishment if only serving employees or pupils of the educational establishment; and restaurants or canteens in a health care establishment.
Inside of a catering facility, all individuals have to wear a mask, except minors under the age of six.
Out-of-store/off-premises commercial activities may be allowed as per § 15 of Government Decree 484/2020.
The policy is slated to end on December 11, 2020. UPDATE: From January 30, 2021, if those in charge of catering facilities do not comply with the measures imposed upon them, their establishment may be forced to close for 6 to 12 months. Also, the policy is extended until March 1, 2021.

description:
Hungary, March 8, 2021:
The National Government declares that all shops/stores have to shut their doors from 5 am to 8 pm ("curfew-free time"). Within this time frame, only employees may be present there. Grocery shops, drugstores, work-related shops (see § 4, section 2, letter c) of Government Decree 104/2021), animal shops, agricultural shops, gardening shops, markets, pharmacies, petrol stations, national tobacconists' shops and newsagents are exempted.
Exempted businesses, with the exception of pharmacies and petrol stations, have to close at 7 pm. During business hours, all individuals are obliged to wear a face mask inside of a shop and on the premises of a shopping centre (with respect to the latter, excluding office areas and premises used for sports and business purposes). Employers may grant breaks from wearing a mask. Minors under the age of six and persons with an intellectual or psychosocial disability or autism spectrum disorder are exempted from the obligation to wear a mask.
Out-of-store/off-premises commercial activities may be allowed as per § 15 of Government Decree 484/2020 (as of March 8, 2021).
The policy is slated to end on March 22, 2021.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Hungary, March 8, 2021:
As part of the temporary reinforcement of security measures, the National Government declares that, in public places, everyone is obliged to limit social contact with other persons— except for persons living in a common household—as far as possible and to keep a distance of at least 1,5 metres from other persons.
The policy is slated to end on March 22, 2021.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
Hungary, March 8, 2021:
The National Chief Medical Officer has ordered a ban on leaving and visiting child protection institutions and correctional institutions. It is only possible to leave these institutions because of a leisure programme organised by the institution or, in justified cases, with the special permission of the head of the institution.
The policy is slated to end on April 7, 2021.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on visiting other group residential facilities (e.g. orphanages; group homes)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
